But the manner of working in it is that you make the patient lie on the prepared and straight saddle, and then take his head in your hands of two parts and hold it so that you see the sania coming to the lower parts, and then let it dry and not descend, and keep the light, and the patient sees the causes as if he were seeing.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not descend below, you know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	But if it is not prepared the descent of the sania with water that we have said, then make the patient lie between your hands and then take a fine spatula and fen it on that over the pannicol, carefully severing the continuation of the conjunctiva with the cornea in the corona (in the place where it is vacant), until the sania is discharged.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Therefore, as it is discharged, then you distill into the wound water cauda in which you have mixed honey or water in which you have already boiled fennel and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	Of the cure of the descending water from the wound.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already said the kinds of water in the division and which ones it is convenient to pierce with a serum, declaring, then this according to the health.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Now, you must make the patient lie between your hands on a board and tie his wound shut, tight.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	And then place your left hand near the eyelid of his wound if the wound with the water is the left one; or on your right hand, if the wound is the right one.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	And then with your right hand, take an almond, if the wound is left; or with your left hand, if the wound is right.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	And then place the extremity of the almond near the corona for the thickness of the ray in the album of the wound from the side of the lacrimal gland, and then peel the almond with virtue and roll your hand on it.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And then penetrate into the album of the wound and feel that the almond has already arrived at the vacant cause.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And it is necessary that the measure of the path of the almond to the bottom is the measure of the space which is from the pupil to the end of the blackness, and it is the corona of the wound; because you will see with that pupil the vision of the wound through the clarity of the tunic cornea.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	And then place the almond into the place where the water is, and then you throw it down once, then another, and then if the water descends quickly, then you wet the patient's wound with water over which he looks quickly, and almond in his wound.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And then rest for a while; then if the water has descended, then you remove that other time until the almond is thrown.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And then when it is dried and does not descend, then you extract the almond with ease, and roll it with your hand little by little, and then dissolve in the water a little clear salt of gemma and with that wash the wound carefully; and then place outside the wound cotton or a stopper or wool soaked in rose oil and egg white and lick the wound with water.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But in those who are of our time, place on that commi trissat with egg white.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if you do not obey your almond to the entrance of the wound because of its hardness—because it is some men whose wound is hard very much—then it is necessary that you take the spatula which is called alberid of which this is the form:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And then pierce with that that conjunction, and do not finish your hand in the track, and it is not if you do not make a way to the almond place subtle.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then introduce the almond according to what we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And you must compliment the work, be prepared to the sleeping patient, made in a dark room, in which he sleeps on his back, and be prohibited from all movements.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And keep in nature to him so that his nature be cleansed, and do not turn his head to the right or left at all.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And be the bandage according to his disposition on the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And then untie that in that dark room and expose the cold sight, and make him see some causes, and then return the bandage on the seventh day.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And do not cover that which you have done at the hour of the cure or soon after the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	You must cover that so that the water may gently flow through great and vehement regardment.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if an abscess occurs, then you must untie the wound before the seventh day, and rectify that with water that yields the abscess.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then you cover the sight of him and place on his face an oral for which the movement of him be regulated, leaving him for some days, him existing in the dark room.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And then be withdrawn from that room gradually and converse in his causes.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in alchemy the disciple is not excused from vision some times, and then you be bold on the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And already it has come to us of some of those which are in Artach, and some said that they made fire in the Ayrac magdaam perforated with which the water is sucked.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	But however, I have not seen in our land any who had perfected water, nor is water written in some of the books of the ancients; and it is possible that this is novel.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the species of magdaan so that it may be upon those who ignore those:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they are made of iron or properly of iron, and their extremities are with this triangular subtlety, the acute extremity as this is the form.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter XXIV.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the cure of flesh nothing in the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When in the nose are born diverse flesh growths, of which some cause is assembled like a scorpion of moth weight, or a polyp weight; and this malady is called polyp because of the resemblance of that weight represented.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And of it is cancerous flesh, pale, of dusky color; and of it is that flesh lion not of dusky color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore in that which is in these flesh lions not fraudulent nor cancerous, you must make the patient be between your hands and placed in the sun, and dry the nostrils of him, and prick your finger in those flesh.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then extract that to the outer parts, and then incise that which you have comprehended of those with a sharp, subtle spatula from one part, as long as you know that all the flesh is gone; that if any cause of it remains, of which the abscission is possible, then you root that with one of the subtle instruments with ease, as long as none of it remains.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if it bleeds or an abscess occurs, then you pause to him that which you must; or if it is of malignant abscesses, then you cut and cauterize that as long as it is cut and the cavities are all gone.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then be put in the nose after the incision a little wine and water or wine.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and from it proceeds humidity into the palate, then you know that it is already healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the humidity does not penetrate as it must, then you know that from it is flesh nothing in the pus sobiras bones of the nostrils to which it has not reached abscission.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore then you must introduce a thread of silk into him of which there is some thickness, and weave in it moth nuts, and place between each nut the quantity of the finger or less, and engage the patient and introduce one extremity of the thread into the nostril with the ray or with another cause which is to him possible.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And because that this has done, that it may be thrown its odor until it reaches the canals of the nostrils, and be spit upon his throat, because troops of times the resemblance to this action do the children at the schools, and it is lighter cause to him who wants to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then place the two extremities of the thread, one extremity that escapes over the nose and the other that remains in the nose, and then administer a lock of flesh with the nuts that are in the thread, and do this as long as you know that the flesh is already with the nuts of the thread.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then extract the thread, and place in the nose after the abstraction of the blood a poultice, and do this for three days or more until the engorged corrodes all that is remaining of the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the cause, place in the nose a lead pipe for some days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you are in need of a cure that requires it, use that.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument a capipurge maker with which are distilled oils and medicines in the nostrils:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make a silver or copper instrument, which is similar to a small open lamp, thus like a small bowl, and the meat seemingly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make a closed tube like a cane, and the tube of the instrument to be a purging maker and be flat, uncovered; to which there is a handle at the back of it, with which you have that when you heat it in oil or water that you want of the suckable causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And this purging is precious: recipe of the forb of beaver, of white balayra, of ginger, and a pinch of saffron, of long pepper, of asafetida, of epetum of spic one ounce. Mix with the juice of blede and caul, and make pills, and one pill is tempered with tepid water, and it is thrown into the nostrils of the patient lying face up.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of the eels' nats in the limbs of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times the eel's nats are found in the limbs of the nose, and it is magnified and mentioned on certain days within which one reads the regard of it.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for that cove that you inscribe that at the beginning of its appearance, and eradicate all of that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then place over the area the cautery or medicine comburent which was in the place of it.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its incision is delayed until it is magnified, then consider if it is calcified, hard, of dusky color and of little feeling, then do not touch that with iron for it is a dangerous abscess; for many times to him who incides this abscess, there falls great malice upon him who had it.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the abscess is of lion touch and is not of dusky color, and times that incision is possible in all of it, then evacuate the patient and incise it without fear, and cure the area with water that exsicates and constricts until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the suture of the nose and of the lips and of the auricle when the continuity is dissolved by plague or by resemblances.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when accidents happen dissolution of continuity in one of these cartilages, few confer in that operation unless in some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when it is necessary to have some cause of those, that consider if it is fresh plague with its blood, and then you adjust the two lips of the plague with suture, and then cure it until it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of dissolution of continuity are already separated, and each one is made healthy, then it is necessary that you excoriate each part of its visible code until blood comes out.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips with suture and strengthen them, and over those pulverize blood of dragon and incense, and place over the powder a patch of diaphynicon plaster, or of some other of the consolidating plasters, and leave that tied for two days or three, and then untie that and change that plaster and leave it until the threads are by themselves abscinditz, and then cure with an enguent until it is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of the suture is that you add the dissolution of continuity or with needles as we have recounted in the suture of the belly, or add the dissolution of continuity with thread as you and have done know.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come in the two lips in the parts of the teeth.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times it is necessary to many men in the parts of the teeth of their lips some abscesses hard resembling fat of worms, and some of them are smaller and some are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, it is necessary that you convert the lips and fendas each of those hardnesses from all parts, and then the abscess incision, fill the place of sage incense until the blood is restrained, and then be washed with wine and be cured the place with water that is stipticitat, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of incision of the flesh adjusted in the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Greatly of times nay on the gum flesh adjusted which the ancients called albulus, therefore it is necessary that you suspend that with an onion or that you have that with the forceps and incise that you must remove its root, and leave the sania to run or the blood.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then place over the area sage incense or other stiptic or excicative powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then incise that secondarily, and cauterize that, for then the cautery will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of reason of teeth with iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth of the parts of the teeth and of the mouth and between the gums are adjusted rough, ragged, and some times are of nigras and are made citrinas or vertz until the gum comes by that corruption and are made the teeth ragged.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And therefore it is necessary that you make the patient sit between your hands and place the head of him in your knee, and scrape the teeth in which appear those roughs and causes resembling sand until of them no cause remains, and that you do of the blackness and of the citrinity and of the others until they are modified.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore, if this is what is in the beginning of the reason, it is good; and if not, then you repeat the reason on those the other day and the second and the third until it comes to the final statement in what you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that the teeth have need of various forms and figures of instruments according to how it is prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And for that the razors which the tooth is razored from the tooth's part is different from the razors which is ras between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of razors you must prepare those which you will see forthwith:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter .xxx.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of the Extraction of Teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	Care that you cure the tooth of its pain with all skill and take your time in the entire extraction of it, for there is no cause that should supplant the healing of it when it is extracted, for it is substance sublime while it is excused in the extraction of it.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	May care when the patient is forced that tooth to be extracted, that firmly you must be certain which is the aching tooth, for many times the pain deceives the patient and leads you to believe that it is in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one and then the pain does not cease until the bad and aching tooth is extracted, for we have already seen this by the operation of the barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, as you must be certain which is the aching tooth, and that you know well, then care that you scarify in the circuit of the tooth with a spatula in which there is some virtue, until it is dissolved from the tooth of the gums of all parts, and then pull that away with your fingers, or with subtle forceps at the beginning little by little until that you succeed.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then apply a strong hold with large pincers for good communication or great stupor, and place the head of the patient between your teeth that you hold well so that it does not harm, and then pull the tooth according to rectitude in a manner that you do not break that one, nor to the patient greater pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And therefore if it is not forgotten, then take one of those instruments, and put that one under it of all parts with facility and exert the removal of it as it was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is broken or corroded, then care that you compress of cloth that broken and tighten that with the extremity of a subtle ray so that it is not broken in the hour of your constriction upon that with pincers.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And care that you work exquisitely with scarification in the circuit of all parts of the gums and guard much your strength that you do not break that and remain a part of it, and return upon the patient by the malice that it be greater than the first pain of it.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And guard yourself that you do not do what some ignorant barbers do in their fisting and audacity about the extraction of theirs, since they do not administer what we have recommended; for many times they make come upon the men maladies great ones that are more difficult to be broken, and the roots of theirs remaugged all, or some of those, or that you extract that with some bones of the jaw as well as many times we have testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And after the extraction of it, the mouth be washed with wine caut or wine agre with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if it should flow blood for that, as many times it should, then apply some quantity of zegi and sprinkle it over the wound, and if you do not confer that zegi, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and subtle pincers with which the tooth is mauled at the beginning be of long extremity, of short handle and thick, so that they are not bent when you must work with those.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And be as well of thick handle so that when you tighten with those they are not bent, be short extremities.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And be made of Indian iron, descentment made of straight extremities, and in the extremities of those be teeth of which some introne in the others and tighten by strong constriction descent, and some times the extremities of those be the form of the beak of a bird the which has name ciconia, so it is gaunt, and are of strong constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter .xxxi.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of the Extraction of Teeth and of the Extraction of the Bones of the Jaw Broken.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you must the extraction of a tooth which is broken remain some cause, then care that you place upon the place a poultice with border for a day or for two until the place be mollified; and then introduce some pliers or pincers the extremities of which are assembled to the beak of a bird called ciconia or gaunt, the form of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The extremities of those be made of flint as well as a file or rasp.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not obey to your easement with these forceps or pincers, then care that you dig upon the root and scrape all the flesh and introduce the instrument which has name atali, so it is a small lever of which the form is this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And be of short extremity thick a little, and not be bent so that it is not broken.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore, if by that the root is fore-gotten, it is good; and if not, help yourself with these other instruments of which these are the forms: the form of the first instrument is of triangular extremity in which there is some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it be triangular and of a more subtle extremity.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And now you are helped with this instrument having two ramps of which this is the shape approaching the following:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And with other instruments which precede in the shape of teeth; for the scraping is done with this instrument which is assembled like a large onion, and this is the shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	Of the triangular, twisted or short extremity, which is some thickness, and not embedded so that it is not twisted.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And other know that the instruments of the teeth move so and similarly the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the skilled and subtle artificers in the art, find for themselves according to what to them signifies the operation and the diverse ailments; for they are of the ailments to which the ancients did not say nor put proper instruments, for the forms of diverse species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the bone of the jaw or of the other bones of the mouth is fractured, or if it may, then it be cured over that in its place with what is to it convenient of the instruments and the forceps which we have said in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and help thee with the gesture of which this is the shape:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let it be in it some thickness little by little, and be strung or held with the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until the bone of all be set; and then restore the place with medicines convenient to that.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if in the bone is a small puncture, then root that of that puncture and of its blackness, and cure that until it be healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the cure of the prominent teeth above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When the teeth are prominent not according to their natural course, then the shape is that, and more so when it befalls women, and more so to the venerable ones; therefore, as you consider: if a tooth is nothing near another tooth, and it is not possible to suture or liniment it, then root that; but that it not be annexed to another tooth, then you incise that with this instrument of which this is the shape; and it is similar to a pig's snout, and be made of Indian iron of a sharp extremity.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And let your incision be with which you incise that in too many days because of the hardness of the tooth, and that it not be damaged another of the teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the prominent tooth is exposed to filing, then file that with a file of Indian iron of which this is the shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it all be of Indian iron and the margin well-made; and let it be of small, pointed points as with a file with which needles are made, with which the tooth be filed little by little in many days with facility, so that no other tooth be damaged and broken.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then line that at the end, and root that with some razors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if the tooth of which a part is fractured and it pricks the tongue, then as you file that until the sharpness of that fracture be stayed and smoothed, and be filled so that the tongue does not prick it and the speech does not break.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of restoration of damaged teeth with gold or silver filings.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When accidents happen to the teeth before concussion and removal by percussion or by fall, and the patient cannot strengthen over that which he eats, and you have cured that with styptic medicines, and it has not availed your cure, then for so that it does not break, it is made in those that are strengthened with gold filings and not with silver, for silver becomes green and as soon as possible, but gold at no time is changed.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the filing be in such subtlety and thickness according to the quantity that it can enter between the teeth; and the shape of the straight is that you take the filing and take double of it between two healthy teeth, and then as you grow with two tortuosities of the filing between two damaged ones, or if it is one or many, until the thread reaches the healthy tooth of the other part.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then iterate the testament into the part from which you commenced, and strengthen your hand with facility and wisdom so that it not be damaged.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your plier with which you strengthen the filings be the roots of the teeth so that it does not escape.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then incise the extremities of the superfluous filing with the forceps or pliers, and add those in each place with gesture, and convert those and hide them between the healthy tooth and the damaged tooth, so that it does not make lesions to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then leave that so straight as a Roman.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loosened or broken, strengthen that or those with another filing in such a manner in all its time.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the shape of the teeth and the figure of the straightening of two healthy teeth and two damaged ones, as well as these tied:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it is done that a tooth or two are returned to their places after the fall of each one, and they are regrown as we have recounted, and that they are re-damaged.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And this is done only by skilled and wise artificers.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes it is fitted some cause of the bones of cow, and it is made as such as the shape of a tooth, and it is placed in the place where the tooth is missing, and it is strengthened as we have said, and remains and serves with that for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter .xxxiv.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the incision of the ligament which comes in the tongue and prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which comes from under the tongue some times or is natural with which man is born, or accidental and happens by plague which is already consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation in it is that men open the mouth of the patient, his head existing in the tieu se; and elevates his tongue, and then incisions that ligament nerve according to the latitude within which it is loosened the tongue from its recess.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if in that there is any hardness or knotting, and this is due to the consolidation of plague, then you put an ounce and split that along the latitude within which you have incised the ligament and it is loosened the knot.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And guard yourself that no fissure be made in the flesh of the preon and that you split here artery and comes flux of blood.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then wash the vestiges of the incision with water or with vinegar or with hot water; and then place under the tongue a licini; so is the which holds the patient under the tongue in any night so that it is not consolidated another time.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if there happens flux of blood, place on the location vitriol trissat; but if the blood vents, then cauterize the location with a cauterizing cautery which convenes to it.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then this cure with the other causes within which it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxxv.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the extraction of a ranula under the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes a boil happens under the tongue resembling a small lump prohibiting the tongue from its natural operation; and often it is magnified within which swells the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation in it is that men open the mouth of the patient sensing before the sun and considers the boil.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it of dusky color or of black, hard, to which the patient does not feel, then do not touch that for it is a cancer.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is inclined to whiteness, in which there is humidity, then you put the ounce in it, and incise that with a subtle spatula, and incise it from all parts; and if blood comes to you in the hour of your operation, then you place above it vitriol trissat, that is, vitriol, within which it is restrained the blood.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work within which you had treated it with compliment of it, within which it is washed with vinegar and salt; and cure this with the other cure with water within which it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter .xxxvi.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of boils of the ears and of that which is nothing in the goiter and of the other boils.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When in the goiter grows, so are the glands which are assembled with cotton, which happen outwards and are called boils of the ears, which when you cure them with water that we have said in the division and it is not healed, then you consider if the boil is hard, of dusky color, of little feeling, then do not touch that with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of red color and the root is thick, then do not touch that with iron for the flux of blood; abandon it within it is matured, and then either you will extract that, or it will be broken by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, soft, and the root of it is subtle, then that is that which is to be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation in it is that you consider, before your operation, if the boil has already rested it with a complete rest or if it is diminished with any diminution; and then make the patient stand before the sun, and his head be in the tieu se, and open the mouth of him, and the servant takes between his hands the tongue of him from under with a noble instrument of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it is made of silver or of brass, and it is subtle with a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Therefore, as you press with that the tongue and it is shown to you the boil, and catch upon that your eyesight, then take an ounce and put it in the middle, and pull that to the parts outwards as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Other water that you pull any cause of the tunics, and then incise that with the instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is assembled to forceps, however the extremities of it are curved, so that the orifice of each one is in the straight of the other, very sharp, the which is of iron indi embedded.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not to you present, then incise that with a spatula of which this is the form of it: And it is sharp on one part, not sharp on the other part.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And since you have incised a furrow, incise the other according to this same manner of incision, and then the incision the patient guard with hot water
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there happens flux of blood, guard with water of decoction of the bark of millefolium or of myrtle leaf and similar to that of the stiptic causes within which the flux of blood is restrained, and then cure this within which it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes there are born in the goiter other boils other than those of the ears, and incise those according to that which I have said in the incision of two furrows equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I had once treated a woman with an abscess which was located in the throat, which abscess had a brownish color, of little feeling, which had already closed the throat, and the woman was breathing with tight meat, and had already prohibited her from eating and drinking water, and she had already arrived at death if she had remained for one day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had already grown so much that it had two chambers inside that burst through two openings.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore, I cut it surgically and remained in one of the openings, and pulled out that part, and thrown away a large portion of it, and then I cut into that from where it understood the other opening, and then I opened the mouth of it, and compressed its tongue, and then I placed the opening in that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I abscessed a large portion of it, and it didn't flow from it except a little blood.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore, the throat of that woman was completely opened, and she began to drink water immediately, and then I ate food, therefore I did not cease to cut into that abscess many times for a long time, and abscesses succeeded in its place, which incision extended as long as that.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore I put a needle and cauterized the throat of her, therefore as much as an addition; and then I walked around and I did not know what God had done to her from then on.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter .xxxvii.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of incision of a boil when it is abscesses.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When a catarr develops in the boil, and it is abscesses and is long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is in the part below thick and round, and then it is called a bubo.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is cured with what we have said in the division, and it does not compare to your cure, and then you see that the abscess has already been cut and is subtle, then cover that which is added round; and if it is to that length, and it is bloody, of brownish color or black, and it is not feeling in it, then cover that incision of it, because in that there is fear on the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see that according to the manner that I have said of its whiteness and length, that you make the patient lie down and press his tongue with an instrument of which you process its shape and then place the opening in the navel, and pull that down and cut it with one of the two instruments which are said in the incision of two mills.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And cover that you do not cut it but what is adjusted over the natural term its addition, because if you cut it more, you will harm their speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, use that which has been recommended in the incision of two mills, and cure that until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient was frightened by the incision of it, cover that you use of a needle in the cauterization of it its fear, and the manner of the cautery in it is only with sharp water, and it is that you place the head of the patient in your se, and then press the tongue of it with the instrument which we have said, and then take of the water which we have said in the chapter of cauterization, and compare with that living cause, and place that no thick nor subtle, and of that fill the concavity of the instrument of which this is the shape:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Be the extramitat of it concavity in which the medicine is placed as well as the concavity of a spoon of ray, and place the instrument with the medicine on the vulva, and the patient yawns on their side so that saliva or mucus of the mouth of that by the intrinscequa medicine, so that no deyssenda of that any cause over the throat of it and that it descends that.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then take your hand with the medicine, and express that on the uvula for the space of half an hour until you see that it is blackened and sedated by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take a piece of cotton and envelopes that over the tip of the ray, and submerge the cotton in the medicine, and introduce the ray with the cotton into a tube of over until the cotton adheres in that tube, and do this as many times until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the uvula, and then remove that because it dries and falls about three days or four.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you think you need to repeat the medicine, repeat that, and after the cauterization, remove it in the circuit of the uvula with cotton soaked in border, and modify with that what is in the circuit of it of the medicine, and be washed with cold water, and be cured for the time being with embrocation, and give it gargles until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of cure is more safe than incision and less long of fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is cured with that which is more subtle than cauterization and incision, because it is cured with fumigation in this manner: take calament, ysop, origua, ruda, sicados arabic, chamomile, broyda and similar to those of the herbs, and adjust all those causes, or some of them, in a pot, and they be submerged in boiling water, and the pot be well washed with decent lut, and be in the middle of the pot a hole, on which be placed an instrument concavity of iron according to this manner; be made of silver or iron.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And the extremity is introduced into the mouth of the patient until the vapor reaches the uvula above the pharynx, until the uvula is somewhat obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then iterate over those moist veguadas until it is dry, and guard yourself that you do not do this cure at the beginning of the appearance of abscesses, because it would too much tighten the abscess, and not the cove that you do this, but you must declare the abscess of it caut.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if this instrument is not at your present, then take a cane and compose in the extremity of it a cup of  wood, so that the mouth of the patient be covered, because the cup of wood prohibits the vapor from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good with health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter .xxxviii.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of the extraction of thorns and of that which adheres in the throat and of the other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Moist veguadas adhereys in the throat or thorn of the foot or any other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Therefore, it is necessary that you extract what of those appears, over which the cat's gaze, because you press the tongue with an instrument before the sun, so that to you is declared what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And that which does not appear and is to you hidden in the throat, it is necessary that you make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because very strong the cause annexed the throat is thrown-out by vomit; or that the patient swallows a piece of bread or of the root of lettuce or a mouthful of dry bread; or  chew a piece of sea sponge dry leon, and tie that firmly with a thread, and then the patient swallows that, because when it arrives at the place in which the thorns and are extracted, then so are thrown-out.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And more take an eel and tie it with a thread, and it is placed and  sucked out; or take a porr and suck the ends and suck the in-between.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if they are not thrown-out with those causes which we have said, then use an instrument of lead according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it is thicker than a ray a small one, and in the extremity of it is a concavity which you introduce into its throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And hold its head elevated upwards, and guard yourself that the touching of its bone of the throat, so that it may be dragged to its body and with that which pushes the bone or the thorn, or that the physician with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But however that the patient that is introduced is better, by its science of the place of the cause annexed and pushes down, and pulls its hand with the instrument upwards, all that according to the quantity which is to it prepared before it is thrown-out.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter .xxxix.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of sanguisuga annexed to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the medicated sanguisuga with that which we have said in the division of the cure with medicines and does not confer, consider then in the throat of the patient to the sun, because you may have comprehended the tongue of it with the instrument which to you we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you see the sanguisuga, extract that with a small one or with a subtle gesture decently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not to you possible to extract with that, then take a concave canula and introduce that into the throat of the patient, and place in the concavity of the canula a burning iron, and do this as many times (until the sanguisuga is dead and is removed from the throat) and abstain the patient all day of water.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then chew a berry full of cold water, and work the mouth of it in that, and wash the mouth with that; and do not swallow any of that cause and evil the water one hour after with its hand, because the sanguisuga as soon as it feels the water catz.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not thrown-out with that which we have recommended, then subfumigate the patient with cimet or with asafoetida by the instrument which we have recommended in the subfumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that it falls.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And it is another manner of operation in the subfumigation of that, is that you take a bowl in which there are burning coals and the bowl is covered with a cover in the middle of which there is a hole, and it is composed in that hole the extremity of the instrument; and then let go from below the subfumigation; and place the patient its mouth at the extremity of the canula, and close its mouth so that the subfumigation is not thrown-out until you know that the subfumigation has arrived at the sanguisuga, because the sanguisuga as soon as it falls.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not fall, then you iterate the subfumigation many times, and abstain the patient from drinking, and eat salty causes and herbs, and do not drink water, and thus necessary is that with this regimen be thrown-out.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which the sanguisuga of the throat is treated when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps as you see, unless that in it there is some curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	Which is placed in the throat, and the extremity of it is similar to the beak of a stork, which is gaunt, in which it is aspired of lime, so that, when compressing any cause, it does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter .xl.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the sum of the discourse concerning abscesses and their section.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are certain special kinds, of certain manners, according to what we remember of them, of each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their piercing and sectioning by two manners, of which one is by the species of abscesses in themselves; and by that which we understand of the humidities.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second manner is according to the places where they occur in the body, for the abscess that occurs in the head is another from the abscess that occurs in the buttock; and the abscess in the fleshy place is another from the abscess that occurs in the joint; and to each of them is its own play by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And more than abscesses are some of which it is necessary that they not be perforated, but until the maturation of the pus in them or the completion of them.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	There are other abscesses which it is necessary to lance when they are ripe, and not until their completion, such as abscesses that are near the joints, for when an abscess is near a joint, its being is prolonged until it can reach what is in the circuit of it, and then its ligaments or nerves of that joint are corrupted, so that it causes a contraction of that limb; or it is an abscess near the main member, and if you delay the perforation of it until it is ripe, it will harm the main member; or it is near the buttock, therefore perforate it before it is ripe; and do not perforate it crude, for lack of proper digestion, but that which is near the buttock, so that you do not pierce its prepuce and make it elongate to the parts of the buttock, and make a fistula, or that it is done at the edge of it that it is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But you must know the hour of the abscess's perforation, and that is when it is ripe.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you must know that it is ripe when there is the cessation of pain and the cessation of fever, and near the diminution of the heat and the pulse, and the sharpness of the head of the abscess, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And that you must know the perforation to be done in the place pus after the abscess and pus coming from the cure of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the perforation should always be done along the length of the flesh or the body, if the abscesses are in the parts of the limbs or the feet, and in the places of the tendons, of the nerves, of the arteries; and, lastly, in all equal places in which there is no reflection; for in those that are reflected, use the perforation according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy place, it is better to let the perforation of it until its digestion is confirmed according to its completion, as we have said; for if you perforate it before that, it prolongs the course of its power and a lot of dirt, and then the lips of it are hardened and the depth of it.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses are perforated according to the latitude of the flesh or the body according to necessity, or according to what the limb needs.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you must administer a small perforation, and in large abscesses a large perforation and many sections according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.
