And if the ulcer is on the foreskin of the uncircumcised penis, and one part of the ulcer is inside the foreskin and the other part is outside, then you should remove the ulcer that is inside at the beginning before it is consolidated; and then you care for the one outside, because when you care for the one inside at the same time as the foreskin, it is not certain that it will not be torn.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And if blackening and corruption occur in the genitals and the foreskin, then you should cleanse all that which is already blackened and which is about to become corrupted or which is already corrupted; and apply a liniment over that with honey, which is mixed with flour of the rind of millet and of herbs finely crushed and sifted.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And care for that with the other cure until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	And if there is a flow of blood, then administer lunar cautery according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Because cautery is useful in two positions at once, so it is for a flow of blood and for the plague when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is corroded and destroyed all at once, then you should introduce into the flesh of the foreskin a lead pipe so that the patient urinates through that.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis (and this adhesion does not occur except in that of whom the foreskin is whole, and on it circumcision is not required; and when adhesion occurs due to plague or abscess) you should excoriate with a blunt spatula until the ligament is dissolved and the head of the penis is freed from all sides.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate them exquisitely, then you should excoriate with a spatula some cause of the head of the penis and the foreskin, and thus it is because the foreskin, when it is thin, is easily pierced through its thinness.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And then separate between the foreskin and the head of the penis with a draft of the thin, which has already been soaked in cold water so that they do not adhere again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then it should be cured with a vi stiptic until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter .lvii.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the purification of infants and the cure of that which occurs to those of circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution of continuity like other plagues: but since it is of our operation and our will, and it is done to those of infants, it is necessary that we assign in that better operation and way lighter loss to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore I say that the ancients did not write about circumcision in some of their books, because they did not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired it through experience, the reason for which is that I have found the majority of the artificers and barbers use circumcision and purification with a scalpel and with tweezers; and they use ligature with thread and incision with the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already tried all these methods and have not found better purification with shears, with ligature with thread than with purification with the nail, because many times the thread escapes below, because the foreskin has two tunics, and the tunic remains deeper, and it is very easily forced to another incision and certain pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And with purification which is done by alphecati, and is digital, of which the butchers use, the incision of the extremity of the virile member is not guaranteed, because very easily it enters into the furrow of it.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with the nail, very easily it obscures iron and corrupts your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the foreskin of the infant is short by nature, and many times it stays in such a manner that there is no need for purification, and I have seen that.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But of the purification that is done with shears and ligatures with thread, the goodness, experience describes to me, because the shears are of proportional incision, for which the sharpness that is below is as the sharpness that is above; and therefore as you press your hand so proportionally to the two sharpnesses, and you incise accordingly by comparison in one time; and it is done compression of the thread with a figure containing the foreskin of the penis from all sides, with which there is no error of all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first operation is that you make the child lie down most if he is of those that understand a little, that you do nothing but you tie the thread on his penis alone, and that you leave it in for another day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then do that with all that manner that is to your possibility of that which receives his intelligence.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then make him lie down between your arms, prepared, and do not be seen; and conceal the shears in your hand or below your leg, that the child does not see those nor any other of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then introduce your hand to his penis and puff into the foreskin, and pull that in until the head of the penis is issued, and then purify that of what is attached to it of dirt.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the location signed with thread double, and lower a little the second ligature below the first, and then take with your finger and indicate to yourself the location of the ligature below with good retention, and incise between two ligatures.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then gently raise the patient's buttocks and stretch the neck of the vessel; and then let the blood flow little by little, for it is better; and place powder over it and on the powder place cloth in which is spread fig ointment with water boiled with rose oil fresh; and leave that on that until the next day; and care for that with care until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the forceps for modification, this is the shape:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Let one pair of limbs be non-cutting and the other cutting, so that the ram of the key does not come out, and the length of the two points be like the length of two equal hand spans.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the error in modification is that too much the buttocks is driven inward, or a part of it, the incision is made.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, as you extend that with your fingernail before the inflammation of the place and that you cut it according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot have it with your fingernail, then extract that with a pin and cut it.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if three days have passed, and that which is inflamed remains, the vessel, then you let it enter until it is ceded the cautery abscess, and excoriate that with facility, and cut it according to what is prepared for you.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And guard yourself from the head of the vessel, for it would not be good for it.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And therefore care for that with the ointment that the plague consolidates from the powders which we have recommended in the treatise of the powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is cut from the buttocks beyond measure, and it obeys the parts above, it will not be good for it.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And but care for that with the ointment that we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter .lviii.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the cure of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is made by obstruction made by stone or by congealed blood, or by pus or by flesh, and similar to those of which we have said of the ways of cure in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved, and sometimes retention of it is by stone which is already in the neck of the bladder, then the patient must be bent over his knees.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And then place the patient's feet on his two and extend his belly from the part above his back, and the patient strains his bowels as much as is possible to him.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, then the neck of the bladder is constricted for expulsion of the stone to the parts behind, so that the urine is absolved.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved with the ointment that we have said and vehemently is made the cause upon the patient, then you must administer extraction from him with an instrument which is called a syringe, of which this is the shape: Be of silver and be a subtle lion's cone, as well as a tube of bird's feather with the subtlety of a long ray in similarity of a palm and a half, to which there is a subtle canal at the head of it.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of the ejection of the urine by this is that you take the needle bent and lies in the middle of it wool or thread for good binding; and introduce the limbs of the needle in the part below of the syringe, and cut with the forceps if superfluous any cause of the wool, but introduce it into the tube with vehemence and then introduce the syringe with board and with album of egg.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient lie on his back, and embrocate his bladder and the vessel with moist oils, and olive oil and water.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then introduce the syringe with facility until it reaches the bottom of the vessel; and then double the vessel above the part of the navel; and then push the syringe into that; and then push it until it reaches the bladder, and that the patient be arrived at the cause would, and it is not made according to this order, but the meat in which it goes to tortuosity.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then extend the needle with the wool little by little, for the urine seeps the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract that and make for cure urine, and use syringe, do not cease to do so and use syringe until the bladder is evacuated and the patient recovers relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter .lix.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the quality of clysterization of the bladder with clampcedra and with similar instruments which are according to this.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When ulcers or abscesses occur in the bladder, or congealed blood in that, or it is constricted by a protrusion, and you want in that to distill waters and medicines, then it is made with an instrument which is called a clampcedra, and this is the shape of it:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	But in the middle of it is deaf, so it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that there are three tubes: two from one part, as well as the other.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning is the concave place, in which is the thing that is poured, and according to the quantity that it fills, it is added, until when any cause is pulled by that of the humidities, it is pulled, and when it is expelled, with water it is pulled, and when it is expelled long, according to what does clampcedra with which is phicat naptha in the battles of the sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, when you wish to expel humidity from the bladder, introduce the extremity of the clamp into the humidity, and draw with that water which is pushed to the upper parts, for the humidity is drawn into the concavity of the clamp.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then introduce the extremity of the clamp into the urethra as we have recounted in the tongue; and then push the humidity with water, for that humidity reaches the bladder immediately, and the patient feels that.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Form of the cristeri subtle by which the bladder is cristerized, and that is the form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is made of silver or lead, of which the head must be like a small feather, and below it a tube is inserted.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And then take the bladder of a sheep, and place in it the humidity that you wish to cristerize in the bladder, and then tie that between two with a strong double ligament, and heat that humidity over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then introduce the extremity of the cristeri into the urethra.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then press your hand over the bladder with the humidity and structure descending until the patient feels that the humidity has already reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder, then you take a piece of parchment and make a circle from it; and pierce that throughout its entirety; and then introduce a strong thread into those holes, so that it is revolved; and then add the circle so that it is attached to the soft part, because you put in that water that you want from the humidities, and oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie that to the instrument and do with it as you have done with the bladder, and express with your hand until the humidity reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter .lx.
De extraccio de peyra.	Of the extraction of a stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division the species of stone and cure of it with medicines, and the difference between stone generated in the kidneys and stone generated in the bladder, and the signs of that.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said the stone in which catz operation with a hand, and section.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder properly is that which is located in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And you know that I am narrating this with manifest exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore, I say that stone generated in the bladder mostly comes to children; and of the signs of it is that the urine that is passed from the bladder is similar to water in its subtlety, and appears in it sand; and the patient feels his urethra, and often it pains, and then it is straightened; and with water you see a hole in the anus in many of those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is easier the healing of children of those who have attained fourteen years; and it is difficult cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young it is milder because it is among those.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that one of which the stone is larger and the cure is easier; And if it is little, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, as we come to the cure of that, we must at the beginning of that modify the patient with the cristeri which extracts all the wound that is in his bowels; because that wound sometimes prohibits the introduction of the stone, and the inquiry of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then place the patient on his feet and be seated and make him groan so that the stone descends to the neck of the bladder, or that it jumps from the place or sometimes.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then make that cezer between your hands prepared, and the hands of it be below the things of him, so that the bladder is entirely made declining to the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then pierce that and all of it through.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the stone in the space, then you cut immediately with a section upon it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not catch all of it with your touch, then you must that you anoint with oil your said index of the left hand, if the patient is a child, or the said middle if it is a young complete, and introduce that into his anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And pierce of the stone until it stays below your said.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And convert that little by little into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press upon that with your said, and expel that to the outer parts ves the place of which you made the section.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the minister that presses the bladder with his hand; and command another minister that with his right hand extends the genitals to the upper parts, and with his other hand re-moves the codpiece which is below the genitals, in part of the place in which the section is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then introduce a spatula, well incident of which this is the form of it:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	And divide in it water that is between the anus and the genitals, not in the middle place, but to the left side of the vagina; and let the section be on that stone and your said be in the anus, and let it be a transverse section, so that the section outside be wide and inside narrow according to the quantity that comes out of the stone, be possible, and no more, because very hard to compress your said which is in the anus the stone and it is thrown by its defect.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that there is some pain in the foot which has an angle and margins, so that its treatment is made difficult by this.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that pain, that one is like a gland, and it is round, and it is made of it light treatment.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore, if it is that one which has angles and margins, adjust it in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not thus formed, then cover that with what you have on it, or what you hold on it with a gentle hand, the extremity of which is like a file with which you hold on the foot, and do not remove it; or introduce a subtle instrument of curved extremity.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot reach it, then you enlarge the wound a little, and if you see a flow of blood, cut it with a strong hand with vitriol mixed.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the foot is more than one, then at the beginning you push your hand into the mouth of the bladder, and then cut it; and then push a little towards that; and similarly do so if there are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the foot is very large, then ignorance is that you cut it with a large incision, because you inflict on the patient one of two causes: either death or that which causes the continuous distillation of urine, because of which the place is not entirely consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But administer expulsion of it while it is formed, or engineer in the fracture of it with the forceps while you extract it in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore, when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with ointment of aloe and dragon's blood, and strengthen it.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place on it a cloth soaked in oil and wine, or in roasted oil and water, so that the abscess may be softened.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And then turn the patient onto their back, and do not untie the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when you have untied it, embrocate the place with water and a little oil, and then cure it with a diaphanition gargle and a diazalition gargle until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound there occurs a foul and corrosive abscess, and of that appearance as if the blood is in the bladder frozen, and by it urine is forbidden (and this is known by the emission of blood with urine), then introduce your finger into the wound and extract that blood, for if it remains it provokes the bladder to corruption of the bladder and its putrefaction.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the wound with vinegar, water, and salt, and in opposition to all species, with what you deem appropriate for its cure until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And cover during all the hours of the cure that you lie both things and adjust the medicines which are placed on the place.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the foot is small and is in the middle of the vagina, and it is stuck there, and the emission of urine is forbidden, then cure it with water which I recommend before you reach incision, because troops have been accused of incision by this cure; and I have already explained this, and it is that you take a wrought iron borer, of which this is the form:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	of triangular extremity, sharp, fitted into a shaft.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And then take a thread, and tie it with that the vagina below the foot so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And then introduce the iron into the vagina, perforating with ease until the borer reaches that foot.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And revolve the borer with your hand in that small foot little by little, and you perforate the perforation of it until you make that of the other part penetrate; for the urine is immediately released.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then press your hand over that which is broken from the foot of the part from the vagina, because that is broken, and it is formed with the urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this cure is not to your liking for any reason which prohibits it, then tie a thread below the foot, and another thread above the foot.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And then cut into the foot in that vagina between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then extract it.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then untie the ligature and modify the congealed blood, which is made in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to tie a thread below the foot, but only so that it does not return to the bladder, and the other ligature above, for when the thread is untied, the foot returns to its place and covers the wound.

And for this reason it is necessary for you when tying the thread above, that you elevate the foot to the upper parts, or that you return to your compliment, and cover the wound as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter .lxi.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of the extraction of a foot from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Foot in women is rarely engendered.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if a foot is seen in any of those, then its cure is difficult, and it is prohibited by troops of manners.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the woman, if she is strong, is a virgin.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you do not find a woman well-versed who describes herself to the physician when she is chaste, or is of women having husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you have not brought a woman who knows this art well, especially the operation by hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the place of the incision on the hip in women is longer than the place of the hip, because you must make an incision in advance, and there is fear in that.

Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore, if you find that, force that, and then command her to insert herself into that.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin, then command the matron to insert her finger into the vagina of the patient and inquire about the hip, because she puts her left hand on the bladder, and comprehend that with good understanding.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa. And then insert herself onto that position of the majority of the vagina to the root of the vagina, of which part she is stopped and feels the hip in that part, and the finger of her is not removed from the hip, short of her.

E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the kinds of hips are many: for some are little and great, and long and rough, and long and round, and having ramps.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you know how many kinds are of it for what you signify about what you want.

And if you see a flow of blood, and you know that the expulsion of blood is from the artery that is incised, then you put powder on the place and tighten that with poultices and stricture descent, and do not repeat that; and leave the hip and do not extract that, because very soon the patient will die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then cure the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Therefore, when the sharpness of the blood is ceded after some days, and the place can be closed, then you return to your operation until the hip is thrown out.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter LXII.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision on hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia ayguoza is nothing but an aggregation of humidity in the white membrane which is below the codena of the genitals containing the huou, and it is called ciphac.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And sometimes it is in the proper panniculus which has prepared it nature in the part of the huou, before it is cuyat that already is another huou; and it is the codena of the genitals between the white membrane which we have said, and it is not that but tart.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is for weakness which happens to the genitals, for that into those is poured this matter, and sometimes happens by percussion made upon the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this humidity is having many colors, for the color of it or is declining to citrine or to sanguine, or red, or is black feculent, or is aqueous white, and that is the most.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known where this aggregation of water is this: for if it is in the white membrane which we have said, then the apostema is round declining a little to length thus as the figure of the huou, and appears the genitals, for the humidity contains that of all parts.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the humidity is in the proper panniculus, then the apostema is round with part of the huou and by this one estimates that it is another huou.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the humidity is between the codena of the genitals and the white membrane, then it catches below the centiment.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And as you want the knowledge of the color of the humidity, then you probe the color of the humidity in the apostema with a  catheter of which the form is preceded; and according to what is seen in the residue of the catheter, judge of what is within it.

And then set you on the left side of him, and command the minister to follow on the right side of him, the one which extends his finger to one of two sides to the codena of the genitals and to the part of the mirac of the belly.

E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And make the incision according to rectum equally distant from the line that runs along the skin of the genitals, until it reaches the white head encompassing.

e es asemblat a letra greca.	and it is assembled in the Greek letter.

De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Of the section on fleshy hernia and its cure.

Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But that which is done by inflammation of the vein is not dispersed from it by any cause of the compression with the fingers.

Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find any cause of it, then you push that into the belly below.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And then you take a needle which is thick and made of x threads, and introduce that through the back of the skin, which is below the cord of the testicles, which is the section; and then cut the extremities which emerge from the thread until they are four threads, and then compose some of them over some figure in the manner of a cross; and tie with that the skin of which we have said that it is left of the cord of the testicles with a strong ligament of two parts.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And then wrap the extremities of the threads and tie those with a vehement ligament so that some of the vessels that nourish those cannot transmit any cause so that from here no abscess may occur.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And pause another ligament according to the first ligament, long from it at least three fingers; and then these two ligaments leave the skin which is left of the cord of the testicles the quantity of the greatness of the finger, and cut all the remaining according to the roundness, and take out of it the fluid.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then cut in the part below of the cord of the testicles by section of which blood flows and heals as we have recommended in that which we have said.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then administer wool soaked in oil, and place it on the wound; and administer the ligament which we have recommended (and sometimes the white skin is cauterized, which we have said near the incision out of fear of blood flow, because many times those occur) and leave the ligament so that by itself it falls.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if the wound of it is late, then of hot water be embroiled, and place it on that so that it falls as we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the wound with the other cure of the wounds until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvi.	Chapter .lxvi.
De hernia ventosa.	Of a Wind Hernia.
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia, no one has been seen to have been bold in the cure of it with iron.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	And the first ones said that it is made as we have recommended in the hernia that is with vi; which is that you tie the vessels near the section over that with facility of it; and then dry in the middle place around the abscess with that which opened it, until the vessels fall.
E cura la plagua segon que havem dit entro que sia sanada.	And cure the wound as we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter .lxvii.
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	Of the disruption that is made in the groin.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes there is a rupture in the groin as we have said, and it emerges the place.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And do not give to the genitals any cause of the intestines to the genitals; and if they give, that is little; and return it in all hours.
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if the time is prolonged with that, it is adjusted fissure in the skin so that the intestine descends into the skin; and this occurs because of the extension of the skin which is in the groin as we have said, which cause is that the skin is extended, and then it is softened and the place is suppurated and emerges.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the cure of it is with cautery as it is preceded by the narration of it.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes it is cured with iron in this manner: and that the patient lies on his two between his hands, and then dry the place of the rupture of the suppurated emerging with section by the latitude according to the quantity of three fingers.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then gently stretch the white cloth that is below the waist until it is uncovered.
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take the ray and place it on the prominent area of the cloth, and press it to the front of the belly.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then stitch the two prominent areas on the edge of the ray of the cloth, and adjust with the suture one to the other.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then pull out the edge of the ray, and do not cut into the cloth at all, nor extend the bowel, nor any other cause like this you shall know in the cure of intestinal hernia.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then cure that with the cure of the wounds, and as you cut the threads, purify that and restore the wound until it is consolidated; because the cloth is contracted and the prominence of rupture is not adjusted.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cauterization is better in this place, because it is more proper to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter .lxviii.
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of softening the scrotum of the testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many times the scrotum of the testicles in some men is softened because the flesh that is between it is softened, and it is felt in regard to it.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Therefore, it is necessary for that one who is requested in the cure of it to make the patient lie according to his two sides, and cut all the scrotum which is softened upon the natural scrotum; and then adjust the two lips with the suture.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you want, stitch at the beginning the superfluity of the softened scrotum with three stitches or four and with firm suture.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	And then cut between the sutures; and then cure by cure of the other wounds until it is healed and the threads fall.
Capitol .lxix.	Chapter .lxix.
De castracio.	Of castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	Know that castration in our law is excused, but for cause it is brought to mind to me that I remember it in this book; and it is not necessary the remembrance of it unless for two ways, of which one is that that it be in the science of the doctor when he is asked about it, that he knows the cure of it to whom it happens; and the other way is that we many times have need of castration of other animals for our use for those, as well as of goats, and of sheep, and of pigs, and of similar to the animals.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: either by attrition, or by fissure to section.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But in that which is done by attrition, the way of the operation is that we make the beast to be seized in warm water until its genitals are softened and are limp and that they hang.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take those with your hand until they are resolved and do not appear after the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration done by fissure and section, cover that you have the beast and press the scrotum of its testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then lay the suspensory, and cut above each testicle with a section between two testicles processed.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then cut those as much as you will have each excoriated.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not leave on those of the cloth any cause, but the subtle cloth which is over the veins.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this way of castration is better the one which is done by attrition, because attrition strongly leaves no cause of the testicles for which the beast desires coyt.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And then cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter .lxx.
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	Of the cure of hermaphroditism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphroditism in men is according to two ways: the one is that it appears in that which separates the space in the scrotum of testicles, in that which is between two testicles figures as a woman's vulva in which it is felt.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And sometimes from that core urine which is in the scrotum of the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	But in women it is a species: and it is that the vulva of the woman over the pubic bone is as two testicles of a man a little of all diminished to the front part as well as the prepuce of a man and two testicles.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the cure is of three species: of two of the men and of one species of the women.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is that whenever you cut those tight flesh until the impression of it escapes, and then that you cure those with the cure of the other wounds.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second species of men of which yeys urine which is in the scrotum of the testicles, there is no cure nor operation in it.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	Of lenting and of prominent flesh for causes of the women.
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	Lenting, strong as it is, is adjusted over natural causes while it is stretched and is made light of its regard; and sometimes it is magnified in some women so much that it spreads as in men and interferes with coitus.
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	Therefore, whenever you have the superfluity of lenting with your hand or with an instrument and cut it.
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	And do not cut in the last incision, mostly in the front of the radit, so that it does not cause a flow of blood.
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	And then take care of that cure of the wounds until it is healed.
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	May flesh born is flesh that is born in the womb of the mother while it is full, and very strong it is produced in the parts before according to the resemblance of a tail (and for this reason, the first ones call this “caudal disease”); therefore, when we cut it as we cut the intestines, and cure it while it is healed.
Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter .lxxii.
De curacio de alratica.	Of the cure of alratica.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	Alratica is that the cone of the woman is not perforated, or the tract is small.
E es o natural o accidental.	And it is natural or accidental.
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	Accidental is due to illness that has preceded, and that is made either by flesh poorly adjusted or by a subtle or thick ciph.
E es fayt o en le preon de la mayre, o en les costatz de lu, o en le pus sobira de lu, o en le pus bas de lu, e prohibeys de cuoyt e de enprenguacio e de enfantament, e fort leu prohibeys las mestruas.	And it is made either in the front of the mother, or in the ribs of her, or in the upper part of her, or in the lower part of her, and prohibits coitus and pregnancy and childbirth, and very strongly prohibits menstruation.
E la cognicio de aquela es fayta per reguardament de la metrona, si la oppilacio es apparent, propdana; mays si no es apparent, lahoras tu cerqua aquela am les tieus ditz o am le ray.	And the knowledge of that is made by examining the metrona, if the opening is apparent, promptly; but if it is not apparent, then you seek that with your fingers or with the ray.
Mays si oppilacio es per ciphac subtil, e es propda a las doas labias, lahoras tu coyta e disromp aquela.	But if the opening is by a subtle ciph, and it is present to the two lips, then you cut and disrupt that.
E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	And it is that you place on the two lips powders, and then place your fingers indicated of both hands at once.
E la femna sia sobre le sieu dos, las sieuas coyssas extendudas, e aprop exten las doas labias am forsa entro que aquel ciphac subtil sia romput e la oppilacio sia uberta.	And the woman be on her back, her thighs extended, and then extend the two lips with force until that subtle ciph is broken and the opening is opened.
E aprop pren lana e enbeu le4 en oli e pausa aquela sobre·l loc, e jagua am home le dia per so que·l loc inscis no sia consolidat.	And then take lanolin and imbue it in oil and place that on the location, and jagua with honey the day so that the location incised is not consolidated.
Mays si le ciphac es gros e espes, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel am spatum lat o am fuelha de mirta.	But if the ciph is thick and thick, then when you cut that with a spatula or with a myrtle leaf.
Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	But if the opening is by carnada, then suspend that with an unci, and incise that.
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou.	And be with you the medicines that cause to cease the flow of blood from bites, such as hacathia, and dragon's blood, and incense, adjusted with the album of a cow.
E aprop aministra una canulha de plom ampla per so que la plagua no sia consolidada leugierament.	And then administer a wide lead cannula so that the wound is not consolidated lightly.
E tengua aquela per alcus jorns e aministra calgua de li sec.	And keep that for some days and administer calgua of the lily.
E aprop sia curada am l’autra curacio de consolidacio entro que sia sanada.	And then be cured with the other cure of consolidation until it is healed.
E alcunas vetz accideys en la mayre nativitat de autres carns, e lahoras cove que inscidas segon aquesta manieyra.	And sometimes accidents happen in the mother's nativity of other flesh, and then when you cut according to this manner.
Mays si aysso es per apostema crancos, a l’apostema crancos le qual es en la mayre no sia fayta contrarietat am ferr en deguna manieyra.	But if this is by a carbuncle, to the carbuncle which is in the mother be not made contrariety with iron in any manner.
Capitol .lxxiii.	Chapter .lxxiii.
De la cura de emorroydas e de tayl e de botor roja que accideysso en le conh de las femnas.	Of the cure of hemorrhoids and of tail and of red boil that happens in the cone of the women.
Emorroydas so apprecio dels orificis de motas venas entro que de aquelas corro mot sanc continuadament; e cum so antiquadas emorroydas e son fayts theyls.	Hemorrhoids are the appearance of the orifices of many veins through which blood constantly flows; and as they are old hemorrhoids and are made they swell.
E ja yeu he dit en la divisio las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e diyre ayssi aquelas que recebo curacio e aquelas que no recebo curacio.	And I have already said in the division the species of those and their signs, and I say so those that receive cure and those that do not receive cure.
Donc dic que emorroydas e theyls quan so en le preon de la mayre e no apparo al sentiment, lahoras en aquelas no sia fayta curacio am ferr.	Therefore I say that hemorrhoids and swellings when they are in the front of the mother and do not appear to the touch, then in those no cure be made with iron.
Mays aquelas las quals so en le orrifici de la mayre sobre las quals catz sentiment, so aquelas que so curadas.	But those which are in the orifice of the mother upon which cats feel, those are the ones that are cured.
E cove que tu metas la femna en mayso frega e aprop exten atheyl am les forfexs, o am drap aspre, e inscideys aquelas am las razitz.	And then when you put the woman in a warm bath and then extend the swelling with the forceps, or with rough cloth, and incise those with the razors.
E aprop pulveriza sobre aquelas deves le fluxs del sanc de una de las polveras insciscivas ses mordicacio, ayssi cum acassia e semblant ad aquels.	And then pulverize upon those of the flows of blood of one of the incised powders bites, such as acacia and similar to those.
E aprop enpellesca les sieus pes per una hora, e aprop pausa aquela en aygua freja.	And then apply her feet for an hour, and then place that in cold water.
E si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras fay aquela sezer en decoccio de sumat e de scorsas de milgranas e de gualas e de semblantz.	And if the flows of blood persist, then make that sezer in decoction of sumat and of the peels of millegrains and of guaias and of similar things.
E aprop pren farina de ordi e comfiys aquela am miel e vi agre e fay emplastre am aquo sobre le dos de lu.	And then take flour of barley and mix that with honey and wine and make a poultice with water on her back.
E si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, fay adherir am dos ventozas, e a las mamilhas ses escarificatio.	And if the blood is severed, it is well; and if not, make adhere to two blisters, and to the nipples their escarification.
E aprop pren lana e submergeys aquela am suc de coliandre o am suc de arnagloza o am suc de guarravier am vi pentit e fay adherir al loc; e aprop cura le loc am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then take wool and submerge that in the juice of coriander or in the juice of arnica or in the juice of guaivier with wine and make adhere to the location; and then cure the location with ointments until it is healed.
Mays athyl rog le qual es de aspre reguardament, cove que tu inscidas aquo que a tu appar de aquel segon que he dit en theyl engualment.	But a boil which is harsh regarding, then when you cut that which to you appears of that according to that I have said in the swelling treatment.
E cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And cure that until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxiv.	Chapter .lxxiv.
De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	Of perforation of eyssedura accident in the mother.
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas.	Many species of abscesses happen in the mother, such as carbuncles and abscesses lapidated and ulcerations and buboes and eruptions and hemorrhoidal fistulas and varicose veins and swellings and other abscesses.
E yeu ja he dit aquestas malautias e las specias de aquelas e les senhals de aquelas, e las curacios de lor en la divisio.	And I have already said these illnesses and the kinds of them and their symptoms, and their cures in the division.
E cove que yeu digua en aquest tractat de apostema caut le qual ve en la mayre quan es dels apostemas que collegeysso sania, e si vols saber en qual manieyra se fa la opperacio de lu am ferr.	And now I tell you in this treatise of abscesses the cautery which comes in the main when abscesses that are festering heal, and if you want to know in what manner the operation of it is done with iron.
Adonc cove que tu consideres si la dolor de la apostema en le sieu comensament es aguda am percussio e flecma e febre, e vezes aquel enrogezir e si catz sobre aquel le sentiment, lahoras no·t coytes am perforacio de lu, e cura aquel am aquo que ajuda sobre la maturacio entro que cesse la acuitat dels accidentz.	Therefore, consider if the pain of the abscess at its beginning is acute with percussion and phlegm and fever, and sometimes that redness and if it catarrh upon that feeling, then do not touch it with perforation of it, and cure it with that which helps on maturation until the sharpness of the accidents ceases.
E lahoras cove que tu fassas cezer la femna sobre una cezelha que aia doas cezelhas; e recline sobre le sieu dos e ajusta les sieus pes a la partida pus dejos del ventre, e las sieus coyssas sian expandudas, e pausa les sieus brasses dejos les sieus denols, e lia quascus am liament ad aquo convenient.	And then consider that you make the woman lie on a bed which has two beds; and recline upon her two and adjust her feet to the part further behind the belly, and her thighs be expanded, and place her arms behind her shoulders, and tie her with a ligature to that which is convenient.
E aprop la matrona segua del latz dreyt e aministre le instrument am le qual es ubert le orrifici de la mayre, la forma del qual vindra en aquelas causas que·s faran aprop.	And then the midwife follows from the left side and administers the instrument with which the orifice of the womb is opened, the form of which will come in those causes that will be done afterwards.
E cove quan vols ministrar aquest instrument que tu fiques am lo ray le preon de la mayre de la femna, e aquo que del instrument es intrat en la mayre no sia mays que·l preon de la mayre e leda le malaute.	And consider when you want to administer this instrument that you put it with the ray on the pubis of the woman, and that which of the instrument is entered into the womb be no more than the pubis and lead the patient.
Mays si l’estrument es major que·l preon de la mayre, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils sobre la textura del preon de la mayre per sso que sia prohibit l’intrament de tot instrument en le preon de la mayre.	But if the instrument is larger than the pubis, then consider that you place powders on the texture of the pubis so that the instrument be prohibited from all instrument in the pubis.
E cove que tu pauses le vertitge que corr en le strument del latz pus desus e que le ministre tengua le strument e revolva le vertitge entro que sia ubert le orrifici de la mayre.	And consider that you place the vertex that runs in the instrument from the left side and that the minister has the instrument and revolves the vertex until the orifice of the womb is opened.
E cum appar la excitura, e es tocada am la ma e es leon e molh, lahoras cove que tu secces aquela deves le cap de lu am spatum lat.	And when the extraction appears, and it is touched with the hand and is lion and moist, then consider that you succeed that of the head of it with a spatula lat.
E cum la sania es evacuada, lahoras cove que tu pauses en la plagua una meca submersa en oli rozat o oli vert en le qual sia alcuna stiptisitat; e pausa la calca7 en la seccio en le preon de la mayre.	And when the sania is evacuated, then consider that you place in the wound a medicament submerged in rubbed oil or green oil in which there be some stiffness; and place the poultice in the section in the pubis.
E pause deforo la mayre e sobre le pentenilh lana munda submersa en aygua en la qual sian bulidas malvas.	And place before the womb and over the pentalin clean wool submerged in water in which there be boiled mallows.
E aprop sia curada aprop dos dias am enguent le qual conveneys ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And when it is cured in about two days with gargles which are convenient to that until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es lavada la mayre e la plagua enayssi que es cristerisat am aygua e mel, e aprop am aygua en la qual es bulhida razit de liri o de aristologia longua, e aprop retorna al enguent.	And some times the womb and the wound are washed in such a way that it is christened with water and honey, and after with water in which the root of lily or of long aristolochia is boiled, and after returns to the gargle.
E si la plagua es dedintz en la mayre ameguada, lahoras cove que tu sias prohibit de la curacio de lu am ferr, habantz cura aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio.	And if the wound is deep in the womb, then consider that you be prohibited from the cure of it with iron, have cure it with that which we have said in the division.
Capitol .lxxv.	Chapter .lxxv.
A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	To teach the midwives in what manner the living embryos be medicated when they are according to a unnatural figure.
Necessaria causa es que la matrona conogua en le comensament la figura del enfantament natural per senhals de lu, e es que quan tu vezas la femna expremar a las partidas dejos e desira odorar le ayre, e sobre aquo es enleujada per aquo que sobre ela es del part, e festina le eyssiment del enbrio, lahoras sapias que aquest part es segon figura natural, e es l’eyssiment de lu sobre le sieu cap, e la segondina am aquel o suspensa o pendent del ombelic.	Necessary cause is that the midwife knows in the beginning the figure of the natural birth by the signs of it, and it is that when you see the woman express in the parts behind and desire to smell the air, and over that it is relieved by that which is over her of the birth, and hastens the emission of the embryo, then you know that this birth is according to a natural figure, and it is the emission of it over its head, and the second with that or suspended or pendant from the navel.
Donc cum tu vezes aquels senhals, lahoras cove que·l ventre de lu sia compremut per so que l’embrio deysenda leugerament quar quan deyssen sobre le sieu cap, deysen a lu la segondina, e es mondada de aquelas superfluitatz am bona mondificacio.	Therefore, when you see those signs, then consider that the belly of her be compressed so that the embryo descends slightly, and when they descend over its head, they give to it the second, and it is cleansed of those superfluities with good modification.
Mays aquel que es otra aquest part es no-natural e no-lausable, quar quan le enbrio es eyssit sobre sos pes e·l cos de lu es eyssit devant le cap de lu e·ls pes de lu, e la ma de lu una, o al pe de lu .i., o es eyssit le cap de lu e la ma de lu, o al ventre de lu, e fort leu es convertit sobre le sieu col, e semblant de las figuras de lu no-lausablas.	But that which is another this birth is unnatural and not laudable, because when the embryo is emitted over its feet and the body of it is emitted before the head of it and its feet, and the hand of it one, or at the foot of it. or it is emitted the head of it and the hand of it, or at the belly of it, and fort leu is converted over its neck, and resembling of the figures of it not laudable.
Don necessaria causa es a la matrona que sia savia e subtil en totas aquelas causas, e que·s guarde de error e de decepcio.	Therefore, necessary cause is to the midwife that she be wise and subtle in all those causes, and that she guard herself from error and from deception.
E yeu so mostrant tota figura de aquelas, e qual engen es en aquelas per so que sia significat per aquo e sia stat sobre aquo.	And I have shown all figure of those, and what engen is in those by so that it be signified by it and be state upon it.
Quan le feyt es eyssit sobre le sieu cap per egrecio natural, e aquel es vehement sobre la femna e es fayt a lu part dificil, e vezes la vertut de lu ja debelitada, lahoras fay aquela sezer , o que las femnas tenguan lu, e evapora le conh de lu am fenugrec coyt e am olis humitz.	When the feyt is emitted over its head by natural egrecio, and that is vehement over the woman and is made to her part difficult, and sometimes the virtue of it already debilitated, then make that sezer, or what the women have it, and evaporates the conh of it with fenugrec coyt and with humid oils.
E aprop entrometa la metrona entre les sieus ditz espatum petit e fenda am aquel la segondina, o secce aquela am la sua ungla entro que corro aquo que es en ela de humiditat.	And then introduce the metron between its said spatums small and fenda with it the second, or succeed it with its nail until it runs that which is in it of humidity.
E preme le ventre de la femna entro que deyssenda le fet.	And press the belly of the woman until it descends the fet.
Mays si no deyssen, lahoras cove que la femna sia cristirizada de mucellage de ptilli e mucellage de fenugrec am cizami.	But if they do not descend, then consider that the woman be christened of mucellage of ptilli and mucellage of fenugrec with cizami.
E aprop comanda a lu, aprop le cristeri, que sia compremuda e fay aquela stornudar am condisi; e te la boca de lu e·l nas de lu per huna hora, quar le fet sira foro-getat tantost.	And then command him, to the cristeri, that he be compressed and make that stir with condiment; and take his mouth and his nose for one hour, because the fat is forgotten quickly.
E si las doas mas del fet so foro-getadas al comensament, lahoras cove que tu redusiscas aquelas am fecilitat petit a petit.	And if the two hands of the patient are forgotten at the beginning, then when you reduce those with facility little by little.
Mays si no obezeys al intrament, lahoras pausa la femna sobre una cezelha e leva les pes de lu sus, e aprop concuceys la cezelha sobre la terra; e la femna sia tenguda que no caia deves la concussio.	But if he does not obey the treatment, then place the woman on a  cella and raise his legs, and then shake the sella on the ground; and the woman must be held so that she does not fall during the shaking.
E si las mas no son dedintz tornadas e morr le fet, lahoras inscideys aquelas e extratz le romament del fet o lia le cors a la ma de lu am drap e extratz aquel am equalitat, quar aquel sira foro-getat.	And if the hands are not distinctly returned and the patient dies, then cut those and extract the entrails of the patient or tie the body of the patient to his hand with a cloth and extract it with equality, because that is forgotten.
De eyssiment del embrio sobre les sieus pes.	From this treatment of the embryo over his feet.
Quan le fet yeys sobre les sieus pes, lahoras cove que tu impelliscas aquels en sus, e aprop convertas le fet petit, e aprop que engualhes aquel, e aprop que prenguas un pe de lu e extendas aquels petit a petit.	When the patient lies on his feet, then you must push those upwards, and then convert the patient little by little, and then that you equalize it, and then that you take one leg of him and extend those little by little.
Mays cum son eyssit entro a las coyssas, lahoras tu comanda a lu que se exprema, e fay aquela extornudar am condizi, quar sira foro-getat si Deus lo vol.	But when it is emitted between the thighs, then you command him to express himself, and make that stir with condiment, because it will be forgotten if God wills it.
E si no es foro-getat am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras tu retorna le fet petit a petit entro que pauses aquel segon figura natural, quar aquel sira lahoras foro-getat am leugier eyssiment.
