And if it is not forgotten with what we have recommended, then you return the patient little by little until you place it according to the natural figure, because that is then forgotten with light treatment.
E si es prohibit am tot aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras pren de musellage de altea e de goma dissolvuda, e percuteys tot en le mortier per bona percussio, e aprop linieys am aquo le conh de la femna, el pus bas del ventre de lu.	And if it is prohibited with all that we have recommended, then take of althea and gum dissolved, and beat all in the mortar with good percussion, and then line with it the cunt of the woman, at the lowest part of her belly.
E aprop fay aquela cezer en aygua tebeza, entro que consegua les ypocondias.	And then make that censer in boiling water, until you achieve the hypocondrias.
E cum vezes que las partidas dejos de lu so lenificadas, lahoras fay a lu subfumiguacio de mirta e sub-pausa aquela a lu.	And when the parts of him are softened, then make to him a fumigation of myrtle and sub-place that to him.
E quan te la sub-fumiguacio per una hora, lahoras tu la fay sezer sobre una cezelha, e aprop fay aquela stornudar e extrenh la boca de lu, e levas de aquela, e prem la partida pus bassa del ventre de lu am leugiera compressio, quar le fet sira tantost foro-getat.	And when the fumigation for an hour, then you make him lie on a sella, and then make that stir and extract his mouth, and take from that, and press the part lower of his belly with light compression, because the patient is quickly forgotten.
Eyssiment del fet sobre les sieus denols e las suas mas.	Treatment of the patient over his knees and his hands.
Quan le fet eyssira segon aquesta forma, lahoras tu engenies en entrometen las suas mas petit a petit; e aprop la femna stia evessada sobre le sieu col, e les pes de lu pengo en jos, e aquelas sia jasent sobre le lieyt, e complegua las suas mas.	When the patient lies according to this form, then you gently insert his hands little by little; and the woman lies stretched over her neck, and his legs hang down, and those lie on the sheet, and complete his hands.
E aprop prem sobre le ventre de lu petit a petit, e aprop extratz aquo que es dejos les pes de lu de las aurelhas entro que sia preparada en la partida pus dejos.	And then press on his belly little by little, and then extract what is left of his legs from the ears until it is prepared in the lower part.
E si le fet no es fora-getat, lahoras pren les pes de lu e mau aquels am movement vehement, e aprop prem aquo que es sobre les ypocondres petit a petit entro que le fet puege a las partidas desus.	And if the patient is not forgotten, then take his legs and move those with vehement movement, and then press what is on the hypocondrias little by little until the patient pushes to the upper parts.
E aprop entrometa las suas mas e engualhe le fet petit a petit, e comanda a la femna que se exprema entro que le fet sia foro-getat.	And then insert his hands and equalize the patient little by little, and command the woman to express herself until the patient is forgotten.
Eyssiment del fet latutidinalment pendent una de las suas mas.	Treatment of the patient laterally while holding one of his hands.
Sia engeniat en reduccio de la ma de lu, mays si no podes aquela reduzir, lahoras eleva la femna e fe aquela anar.	It should be engineered in the reduction of his hand, but if you cannot reduce that, then elevate the woman and make that go.
E si anar no pot, lahoras fay la jazer sobre le lieyt, e concuteys las coyssas de lu am concussio vehement, e aprop aministra liamentz les quals yeu e recomtatz de mucillages.	And if it cannot go, then make her lie on the sheet, and shake her thighs with vehement concussion, and then administer liaments which I have and recommend of mucillages.
E si es vengut le enfantament, lahoras fay aquela sezer sobre cezelha, e aprop studia sobre la reduccio de la ma, e enguala le fet segon figura natural, e fay stornudar la femna e comanda a lu que comprema a si entro que sia foro-getat.	And if it has come the childbirth, then make her lie on a sella, and then study on the reduction of the hand, and equalize the patient according to the natural figure, and make stir the woman and command him to compress himself until he is forgotten.
Eyssiment del fet sobre·l col expandudas las suas mas e la fassia de lu es al dos de la sua mayre.	Treatment of the patient on the neck with his arms outstretched and the fascia of him is on the side of his mother.
Cove que la matrona tengua la ma del fet e aprop revolva aquel petit a petit, e eque aquel am facilitat.	You must have the midwife hold the hand of the patient and then turn that little by little, and that with facility.
E cum es e quant so es engualhat, e lahoras pausa sobre le conh de lu aquo que havem recomtat de oli e de mucellages.	And when it is and as much as it is equalized, and then place on his cunt what we have recommended of oil and mucillages.
E aprop comandas a lu que·s maugua petit a petit, e quan auras feyt aquo, lahoras fay aquela cezer sobre una cezelha e comanda li que sia inclinada sobre le latz dreyt, e aprop comanda a lu que sia compremuda; e fay aquela stornudar am condizi.	And then command him that he move little by little, and when you have done that, then make her lie on a sella and command him that he be inclined on the right side, and then command him that he be compressed; and make that stir with condiment.
Exitus foetus praeparati super latus.	Exit of the prepared fetus on the side.
Quan deyssen a horrifici de la mayre segon aquesta manieyra, considera, e lahoras tu inscideys la segondina am la tua ungla entro que sia evacuada de la humiditat.	When they should give the horrifici of the mother according to this manner, consider, and then you cut the second one with your nail until it is evacuated of the humidity.
E si le fet es suspendut sobre la cara e·l col de lu, lahoras tu inscideys aquela del embelic, per so que no sia retengut e mora.	And if the fetus is suspended over the face and neck of him, then you cut that of the navel, so that it not be retained and die.
E aprop empelleys le fet a las partidas dedintz entro que pauses aquel segon que cove, e manda a la femna que comprema a si alcunas veguadas, e el sira fora-getat am eyssiment leugier, si Dieus o vol.	And then push the fetus to the distinct parts until you place that second one which you cover, and command the woman to compress herself several times, and it will be forgotten with light treatment, if God wills it.
Exitus geminorum aut foetuum multorum.	Exit of twins or multiple fetuses.
Sapias que gemels motas veguadas so natz, e alcunas vetz naysso tres o quatre , mays aquo es estranh e tart s’endeve; mays v so causas foro natura, e no vivo.	Know that twins are born many times, and sometimes three or four, but that is strange and hard to endure; but it is from natural causes, and not alive.
E conte aquelas, ja sia que sian montiplicatz, una segondina, e son seperatz per ciphac, distingen aquels enter le liguament en l’ombilic de cascun de aquels E alcunas veguadas so foro-getatz ayssi cum es un fet per eyssiment natural leugier, e so eysitz alcunas veguadas per eyssiment no-lausabla ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And counting those, whether they are multiplied, a second one, and separated by a circle, distinguish those among the ligament in the navel of each of those, and some times they are formed as it is a natural light emission, and they are emitted some times by a non-natural emission as we have recounted.
E si son dificils alcus de lor deves le enfantament e perveno ad aquo que havem dit de las figuras no-naturals, lahoras tu cura aquels ayssi cum havem recontat.	And if some of them are difficult to the birth and reach what we have said of the unnatural figures, then take care of those as we have recounted.
E si’ la matrona subtil e fassa aquo que fa am facilitat e subtilitat, e am tarditat, e sia ingeniat segon tota figura segon que es a lu preparat de l’engen amenant a salut.	And if the midwife skillfully and makes what is done with ease and subtlety, and with delay, and is ingenious according to all figure according to what is prepared for her by the art leading to health.
Rememoratio eius quod formatur in matrice ex embrionibus et Abortiuntur.	Remembrance of it that is formed in the womb from embryos and are aborted.
Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis.	Sometimes they are formed in the womb one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, and sometimes ten, and it has already been verified that one woman aborts six, and another ten, all of which is caused by the measurement of the glorious wise.
E tot aysso cove que sia en la sciencia de la matrona quar fort leu ad aquela parve semblant de aquo, e donc opause se ad aquo am so que cove.	And all this cove that is in the science of the midwife, because it is very useful to that appearance of this, and therefore it is paused to this as much as cove.
Capitol .lxxvi.	Chapter .lxxvi.
De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	Of extraction of the fetus when it is dead.
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio.	When you cure the dead fetus with what we have said in the division of the medicine and it is not outside emitted, and you are forced to use of operation with hand, then cove that you consider if the woman is of healthy virtue and is not with any of the accidents by which she is feared for perdition.
Lahoras cove que la femna sia envessada sobre le lieyt sobre le sieu dos, e sia le cap de lu enclinat enjos e las coyssas de lu sian elevadas.	Then cove that the woman be laid on the sheet over her two, and be the head of her inclined downwards and the thighs of her be elevated.
E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	And the minister have those of two parts or be tied in the sheet so that the body of him no extend during the extraction of the fetus.
E aprop tu humecta la boca de la mayre de lu am olis humitz e am mucellage de altea e de fenugrec e de semensa de li.	And then you moisten the mouth of the mother of him with humid oils and with mucellage of altea and of fenugrec and of seed of lily.
E aprop unte la matrona la sua ma am aquels olis e mucellages, e aprop entrometa la sua ma am fecilitat en la mayre, e aprop cerque am la ma loc en le qual fique les uncis en le fet.	And then the midwife anoints her hand with those oils and mucellages, and then introduces her hand with facility in the mother, and then seeks with the hand in the place in which the fetus lies.
E locs convenient en aquo: adonc tu considera si le fet es preparat que deysenda sobre le sieu cap, e lahoras tu fique les uncis en les huels de lu, o en le col, o en la boca, o en le palat, o dejos la barba, o en la furcula de lu, o en les locs propdas de las costas, o dejos les ypocondres.	And convenient places in this: therefore you consider if the fetus is prepared that descends over its head, and then you place the uncis in the heels of it, or in the neck, or in the mouth, or in the palate, or behind the beard, or in the fork of it, or in the proper places of the back, or behind the hypochondria.
Mays si le deysendiment es sobre les pes de lu, lahoras en le pentenilh, o en le mieg de las costas.	More if the descent is over the feet of it, then in the pentinilh, or in the middle of the back.
E cove que tengua le unci am la ma dreyta, e pausa la curvitat de lu en aquel loc le qual es entre les ditz de la ma senestra, e entrometa la ma am facilitat e fique le unci en alcu de aquels locs les quals havem ditz, entro que pervengua a la causa boyda.	And cove that he have the unci with the right hand, and pause the curvature of it in that place the which is between the fingers of the left hand, and introduces the hand with facility and place the unci in some of those places the which we have said, until it reaches the left cause.
E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament.	And then pause and place in the opposite position of it another unci, or the third if it is necessary, so that the traction be equal, and not be extension according to its rectum only.
Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	And be maugut to all part, so that the emission of it be alleviated as it is done during the eradication of it.
E cove en lu aquo que es entre lor que la extencio sia mollificada; e si alcuna partida de lu es retenguda, lahoras cove que la matrona unte alcus sieus ditz am oli e entrometa aquels espertament e revolva am aquels aquo que es retengut.	And cove in it that which is between them that the extension be mollified; and if any part of it is retained, then cove that the midwife anoints some of her fingers with oil and introduces those expertly and revolves with those that are retained.
Donc si la partida del fet es fora-getada, lahoras les uncis sian permudatz entra loc le qual sia pus aut; e fay aysso entro que tot le fet sia fora-getat.	Therefore if the part of the fetus is out-gotten, then the uncis are changed into the place which is most high; and do so until all the fetus is out-gotten.
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	But if the hand is issued before the other, and it is not possible to reduce it by the constriction of it, then cove that a cloth be enveloped over it; and then extracts it until all is out-gotten, and incides it either in the junction of the hand or in the groin.
E ayssi cove que fassas en l’autra ma e en les dos pes.	And thus cove that you do in the other hand and in the two feet.
Mays si le cap del fet es gran, o accideys a lu coartacio en le eyssiment, o es en le cap de lu aygua ajustada, lahoras cove que entrometa entre les ditz espatum spinos e fenda le cap e extragua la aygua, o que discroba aquel am un instrument le qual es nompnat “alundat”, la forma del qual vindra am las formas dels autres instruments en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	But if the head of the fetus is large, or there is constriction in the emission, or there is water adjusted in the head of it, then cove that you introduce between the fingers of the scapula and split the head and extract the water, or what describes this with an instrument which is called "alundat", the form of which will come with the forms of the other instruments in the chapter which is next to this.
E semblantment fassa si·l fet es de gran cap per natura: e lahoras cove que inscida aquel am algematu, o que prengua aquel am alunda ayssi cum havem dit; e aprop extra les osses am les forceps.	And similarly do if the fetus is of large head by nature: and then cove that you incides it with the algematu, or that you press it with the alunda as we have said; and then extract the bones with the forceps.
E si le cap es eyssit e es coartat deves la furcula, lahoras sia fendut entro que la humiditat la qual es en le pietz sia efunduda.	And if the head is issued and is constricted by the fork, then it be split until the humidity which is in the feet be poured out.
Mays si no es complicat, ni obezeys a eyssiment, lahoras tu inscideys le cap tantost segon que a tu sira possible.	But if it is not complicated, nor obese, then you cut the head as soon as it is possible to you.
E si le dejos del ventre es apostemat o es en lu ydropici, lahoras cove que tu perfores aquel entro que corro la humiditat que es en lu.	And if the folds of the belly are abscesses or are in it hydrophic, then you must pierce that within which flows the humidity that is in it.
Mays si le fet es sobre les sieus pes, lahoras la atraccio de lu es leugiera e la direccio de lu a la boca de la mayre es leugiera.	But if the fact is on their feet, then the attraction of it is lighter and the direction of it to the mouth of the mother is lighter.
Mays si es coartat deves le ventre e·l pietz, lahoras cove que tu extraguas aquel am drap le qual auras envolopat sobre la tua ma, e que fendes le ventre e·l pietz entro que corra aquo que es en aquels.	But if it is constricted of the belly and the foot, then you must extract that with a cloth which you will have enveloped over your hand, and that you make the belly and the foot within which runs that which is in those.
Mays si les autres membres so ostatz e torna le cap, lahoras la metrona entrometa la ma senestra; mays si la boca de la mayre es huberta, lahoras intrometa la ma en le preon de layre, e cerque am aquela le cap, e atira aquel am les ditz entro a la boca de la mayre, e aprop entrometa en lu un unci, o dos uncis, e atire lu am aquels.	But if the other members are held and the head returns, then the metron inserts her left hand; but if the mouth of the mother is closed, then she inserts her hand into the preon of her, and seeks with that the head, and pulls that with her fingers into the mouth of the mother, and then inserts into it a hook, or two hooks, and pulls it with those.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	And if the mouth of the mother is constricted by an abscess caused by a cautery that has fallen on it, then you must not tremble over it; rather, you must administer an infusion of humid fatty causes.
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	And administer plasters; and follow the patient in waters that soften and moisten.
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	And if the fact is on their side, then if possible, it should be lanced; and it should be administered with the water that we have said in the living fact.
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	And if that is not possible, then it should be incised in pieces, and extracted.
E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	And you must not leave any cause of the second kind.
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	And when you will have completed all your operation, then administer the water that we have said of the cure in the cauterized abscesses which have fallen on the mother.
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	And if there occurs a flux of blood, then send them down in styptic waters and administer the other cure.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And I have already seen a woman in the belly of which was a dead fetus, and then above that fire another pregnancy, and then the dead fetus is another.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	It happened to a man a long time ago an abscess in his navel; and it inflated so much that it opened, and began to discharge pus.
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And I was called to the cure of him, and medicated him for a long time, and the plague was not consolidated.
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	Then I placed on him some causes of strong attraction plasters, and extracted from him a bone, and after passing some days, and extracted another bone; and I was too amazed, as in the belly there were no bones.
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	And then I thought that they were of the bones of the dead fetus.
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	Therefore I continued to treat the abscess, and extracted from it many bones, the woman existing in her usual dispositions, and already living in that manner for a long time, cured of it a little pus.
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	And I do not affirm that this is strange, but that in this there is science and help to that which the physician performs with his hand for the cure.
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	Of the forms of the instruments that are necessary to extract the fetus.
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	Form of a vertigue with which the mother is opened:
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the form of a stretcher in which the boards are joined, to the joining of which are two vertigues in two extremities of two boards.
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	But however this vertigue must be more subtle of strictori, and be made either of ebony or of wood of boys.
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	And it should be the width of each stick two fingers, and the margin of each one is one finger, and the length of each one is one palm and a half; and in the middle place of two sticks are two adjustments of that same stick, which are already finished, of which the length is the majority of one palm and a little more, and the width of each one is two fingers, or a little less.
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	And these two additions are inserted into the mouth of the mother so that it may be opened with those when you revolve the two prescribed vertigues.
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	Another form similar to that more subtle and lighter:
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	It is made of ebony or wood sticks according to the resemblance of forceps.
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	But however, at the extremity of it are two additions as if it were, and the length of those additions is about one palm, and the width of each one is two fingers.
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	And as you want to open the mother with those, then you make the woman lie on her back with her feet dangling, open that which is between her thighs.
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	And then open your hand with the instrument as if you were doing with forceps, accordingly to the quantity that you want of the opening of the mouth of the mother until the metron makes it so that you want.
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	The form of vertigue which the ancients said:
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	Form of impellent with which the fetus is pushed:
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	Form of amisidat2 with which the large head is contained
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	And it is assembled to forceps with teeth at the extremity, as if it were, and some times it is made long as if it were forceps according to this form, as if it were, to which there are teeth as if they were teeth of a saw with which it is incised and contained.
Forma de amesidat pauc:	Way to mediate a little:
Forma de unci havent una spina:	Way to treat a person with a spine:
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	Way to treat a person with two spines:
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	Way to make forceps with teeth of iron with which the head of the fetus is contained:
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	Way to make a spatula with two extremities with which the head is severed:
Forma de dos espatums latz:	Way to make two spatulas wide:
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All those instruments are exercised, and when more are multiplied the kinds of them and they are prepared, the artificers are lighter in their operation and more useful to men by their quantity.
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And in the works of those instruments, whatever kind they are, you should always be prepared, because the need for them is not excusable.
De extraccio de la segondina.	Of the extraction of the secondine.
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the secondine is retained in childbirth, then you command the woman to retain her breath, and then make her to strain with condition, and strengthen your hand over her mouth and over her nostrils, and if by this it is brought forth, it is good.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And if not, then you take a cloth and perforate in the cover a hole and place in that herbs burning in the mouth of the mother, thus as calament and rue and anise and chamomile and sicados arabic and cinnamon and centaury.
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All these herbs or some of them are submerged in water in the cloth, and place that over the fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	And then place a tube of cane in the mouth of the mother, and keep that inside so that the vapor comes to the cavity of the mother.
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	And then make her to strain as we have said, and the secondine is ejected with velocity.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	But if this cure remains and it is not brought forth, then you command the midwife to submerge her left hand in sesame oil or in a mixture of althea, and then introduce that into the vagina and search with that for the secondine, and when she has found it, then she takes it and extends it little by little. But if it is attached in the perineum of the mother, then she introduces her hand as we have recounted, and when she has found the secondine, she extracts it little by little according to rectum so that the mother does not suffer violent traction.
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	It is necessary that it be changed to the right and left sides with facility.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	And then it should be adjusted in the amount of traction, for it will obey and evade adhesion.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	And if the mouth of the mother is constricted, we have already recounted the cure with straining and with medication of the cloth with herbs.
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	But if it is not brought forth with all the causes that we have recounted, then guard yourself that you do not tire over it in iteration of abstraction, but rather that what is brought forth from it to the mouth of the mother lies on the cloth of the woman, and then sterilize that with an enguent and tetrafarmacon; for this will cause it to rot a little after a few days and it will be dissolved and it will be brought forth.
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	But when it can be done, it is elevated to the head and stomach, and this is what the woman feels; and therefore it is necessary that fumigations and conveniences be administered to it.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	But some of the Ancients already were using fumigations of mastic and dried figs.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	Way to make an instrument with which the woman is fumigated for the retention of menstruation and of the secondine:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	It is made of  wood or of iron.
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	And it is placed with the subtle extremity in the vagina and the wide extremity over the fire, and the fumigation is placed over the embers of the fire.
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And keep that inside so that the fumigation is consumed and iterate another.
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	Of the cure of the un-perforated child's anus.
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	Many children are born and their anuses are not perforated, those which are very subtle and opalescent.
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	Therefore, it is necessary for the midwife to perforate with her finger that opalescent; and if not, perforate it with a sharp spatula, and guard yourself that it does not touch the sphincter.
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	And then place on it wool infused in wine and oil; and then cure it with an enguent until it is healed.
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	But if you fear that it is opalescent, then place in the hole a tube for many days, and remove it when the child wants to defecate.
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	And already accidents opalescence of the anus by consolidation of plague or of abscess; therefore, it is necessary that that consolidation be incised, and then it be cured with what we have said of the cure and of the lead.
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	Of the cure of fistulas that come from the bowels.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	The fistulas that come from the part of the bowels, low, so knotted and thick, those that come from near the anus outside or in the space of the one part.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is a fistula or many.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And as that knot is ancient and flows from the humid white or subtle rot, and sometimes in these fistulas some penetrate.
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And those that penetrate are known by what is brought forth from them by the egress and by the windiness; and sometimes the woman of egress, and very often it is brought forth from them worms.
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	And some of those fistulas sometimes penetrate into the space, into the bladder, and into the meat of the vagina; and some of these penetrate into the junction of the groin and into the knot of the hip.
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And in what is known as a fistula penetrating into the anus and not penetrating, is that you put your finger inside the anus, and you try to insert a thin probe of wax or iron into the fistula when there is no blockage.
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	But if there is a blockage in that, then you insert a thin probe of lead or horsehair into it until you feel the probe or hair in your finger.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you don't feel that at all, nor does any cause of stool, worm, or wind come from the tract, thus as we have said, then you know that it is not penetrating, and then you turn to its cure.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or into the meat of the vagina, then the meaning of it is the emission of urine from that and prohibition of it so that the place may be consolidated with medicine.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	But if it is penetrating into the junction of the groin or into the hip and there is a feeling of pain in the area, then the sign of it is that the probe penetrates here if there is no blockage in it into the hip, and a feeling of pain in the area of the groin; and that it always brings a discharge; and that it doesn't work in that medicine, nor is it consolidated with rinsing.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all of those fistulas, there is no cure for all, and the cure for them is the work and variety of the physician's leaves upon which it is based.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in that which is not penetrating and not ancient, healing with iron is expected according to what I tell you, and what I have already tried.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And it is that the patient lays between your hands on his two and elevates his legs into them, the thighs being inclined to his belly, and then you insert a probe of lead, or wax if there is a blockage in the fistula, until you know the location where the probe penetrates.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if that feels the patient around the buttock, then cover that you insert your finger inside the buttock.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel in your finger the probe already by itself penetrating, or another that you feel between your finger and that skin or flesh, then you know certainly that it is penetrating; and therefore don't work on that, for it is not in that healing, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	But nevertheless, some say that it is healed in some men tart.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And of the medicine by which healing is expected in it is that you ignite a subtle cautery according to the width of the fistula, as it is preceded, and insert that ignited into the fistula until it reaches around the buttock; and then repeat that two or three times until you know that all of those flesh adjusted to the fistula, that are similar to the feather quill of a bird, are already cauterized.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And then cure that with poultices wrapped in border until all of those flesh that are cauterized are covered, and then cure that with medicines that generate and consolidate the flesh, and if it is healed, well is; and if not, then it is not healed in any time by other cure.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the probe enters, and does not penetrate into your finger which is in the buttock, and between that and the probe which is veiled with skin or flesh, and sometimes the fistula in that which seizes the surface of the buttock, then dry the buttock from the beginning of the fistula, and you see drying with the probe, and it is in the fistula until the drying reaches the place where the extremity of the probe reaches, and by the probe it is liberated and caught.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then purify those fistula-ridden flesh, which are assembled like the feather quill of a bird, and do not remain any cause from them.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	But if a flux of blood sometimes comes between you and your operation when you are cauterizing those flesh, then the best that is, and of the lightest instrument is to cauterize with fire or with acute medicine, for cauterizing with fire adjusts good two habits: it is the cauterization of those flesh adjusted, and the abscessing of the blood, the excretion of the humidities.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And then cure that with poultices wrapped in border or in tripe until the place gets braced, and then cure the plague with rinses of hard flesh-generating and consolidating.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And so medicines in which there is astringency and excretion; when then it is restored, it is already healed and you fear no iteration.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula already reaches into the front of the buttock and is elongated from its surface to the body, then insert your finger into the buttock and inquire with that.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And therefore if you feel the probe and between you and it is veiled with flesh or skin, and it is proper to penetration, then it is not an operation in it but according to your trust and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	The which cause is to administer in it one of three ways: or that you cauterize it as we have said; or that you dry it until you obtain the concavity of it so that it is possible for you to insert the probes and the proper cure; and do not proceed to cut it so that you do not cut the ligament containing the buttock, and which happens over the patient in the emission of the stool by his will; and then cure that with what we have said that strong leeches heal; or that you lengthen that veil and cleanse that pus that dries that within the buttock, as we have said, or with a probe or another instrument of sharp extremity, and then purify those fistula-ridden flesh which are in the incision where you can make a percussive; and then strive to make the restoration of the whole plague with incision, and if the orifice of pus above is not consolidated, and the fistula remains open in the part of the buttock, and pus light remains for the patient.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes the fistula is finished in this way: when you introduce the probe into the fistula, and it is in the place of the anus around the surface of the body with the chain and on the edge of the anus, then take a probe of perforated extremity, which is like a needle of preparing the hearts according to this form:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	And introduce it into that faithful envelope of v threads or around those; and then introduce the probe with thread into the fistula until you achieve its cavity.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	But if it is penetrating in the edge of the anus near the entrance, then you extract the thread from that tract so that you introduce your finger into the anus; and extract the extremity of the thread and adjust the two extremities simultaneously, and tighten each one, and leave it for a day or two, and when you have incised the thread deeper into the flesh, tighten well that which those flesh parts are incised between the two extremities of the thread and that they join.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And then cure the plague while it is consolidated and healed.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	But if the orifice of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate, in whatever way it is prepared, but not that it is moved in the groin, because it is not to you that you should do this so that you do not cut the tendon; and then make it with that until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of the spatula spines with which the fistula is cut: the curvature of which is very sharp and the other part is not sharp, so that you do not cut what is not necessary, as sometimes.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	Of stitching hemorrhoids in which blood flows in the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are in two ways, which are between the anus similar to those that are of carbon, or which those are like the fat of a raisin.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And of those are small and large, and that the blood flows from those always and is one, and are many, and are outside the anus, and in the extremities of it.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	But however, those that are outside the anus are according to the little moisture, of which flows a little water or a little blood with a continuous body, and are according to the color of the body.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the cure of those that are inside the anus is that you command the patient to squat and to squeeze until the anus is empty and the hemorrhoids appear to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you take and suspend with hooks or whatever you have those with your finger, and then cut those deeply to their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	But if the hooks are not held in those because of the moisture of them and their softening, then take those with rough cloth or with a stick or with wool fleece, and extract those with your fingers, and then cut those and pulverize upon them some powders caudas near the incision, so that they are applied to those in place of cauterization; or cauterize those according to what is preceded in the chapter of cauterization.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then cure those with the other cure until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the anus does not obey the egress, then cauterize the patient with cauteries in which there is a small bite, and wash it with that water that is in the anus and that obeys the egress slightly when the patient is squeezed.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then the cause of them is lighter, and it is that you take those with your finger, or that you take those with a hook, and cut those, and then cure those with the water that we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And that which you have incised, cover that you administer suture of them according to this way: take thread enveloped and introduce it into a needle and then extract the hemorrhoids to the upper parts, and make it penetrate with the needle into the root of the other part, and encircle the two extremities of the thread in the part farthest from the needle, and it is laterally; and tighten the hemorrhoid with strong structure, and then knot the thread and extract the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do this to all, and leave one of those and do not stitch it, so that the superfluity of the blood flows from that.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And then place on the anus cloth soaked in rose oil or in cerot; and place that on the anus and command the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then leave that until it heals; and when it is healed, cure those with poultices or with other cure until it is healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	Of the cure of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Many times they happen due to the dryness of the wound or due to the constriction of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And as they are ancient and do not work in that medicine, then you must scrape those with the point of the spatula or with your finger until they are made humid and there is a host of those the pus below, which prohibits those from consolidation; and then cure those until they are consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you open those with a reason of pus vehement that the first one until there is much blood and they are excoriated; and then cure those until they are healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	Of the cure of almesamir, it is called.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	Know that almesamir, it is called, and it is nothing but a red knot according to the color of the body resembling the head of a clavicle, and it is made in all the body and mostly in the parts below the feet and in the fingers, and therefore by those pains the ailment.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And therefore, the one that is incised that which is in the circuit of the key, and it is held with the forceps or with an awl, and it is eradicated from its root; and then care for that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, cauterize the second that precedes in its chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	But of wart is a small, rough, fistulous, round eminence on the surface of the body, and many times they come in the hands of children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the cure of it is that you extend and cut that, or that you tighten that with a thread or with a needle that is put inside that.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, cauterize that, according to what we have said, with fire or with acute medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And already eradicated both ways and vice versa with the instrument which I have told you.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	But the ant hill is a small, fetid or fistulous eminence on the surface of the body, going to the pain, and when the ant finds that it is felt in it, seeming like a bite of an ant, and it is made around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the cure of it is that you take a tube of hawk feather or of vulture feather, and it is strong, and you place that over the ant hill while you contain it the circle of the tube from the parts of it; and then you turn your hand with the tube while you cut that which is in the circuit of the ant hill, and you place that in the skin of the flesh, and that you eradicate the ant hill from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, do that with a tube of brass or of iron according to this form:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	Let the part above the tube be drawn to subtlety, deaf (so it is not perforated), enveloped so that over the said, the apprehension of it be abated and the revolution of that.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you wish, cauterize the ant hill according to what is said before in the cauterization of the boil in the chapter of cauteries.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	Of the form of the instruments that are administered to give christening.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes christening is made of silver or of laton or of brass melted or hammered; and sometimes it is made of those instruments small and great according to those to whom they are administered, that the one that is administered in the cure of the small children be small; and of those whose buttocks are sore or painful, the christenings of those are small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of the large and few christening:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the tube of it above in which the bag is tied be wide according to this manner; and be to it the distinction the one in which the bag is tied as well as sometimes.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the extremity of it more down, the one which is inserted into the anus, be deaf (so it is not open) much lion, drawing to subtlety; and in one of the sides of it be two holes, and in the other side one hole, and be the width of the hole according to the thickness of the rays and more thick a little.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And be the bag in which be placed the medicines of bladder of beast or of sheepskin, and the root of it be a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And be perforated by many holes as it is revolved; and if the space which is between the holes the thickness of the finger.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those holes a strong thread of raw thread which be of ten threads, or about those; and adjust with that the bag; and when it is placed in it the bag, be tight in the head of the christening between two distinctions with strong constriction, and then cauterize with that each hole: But the quality of cauterizing with that is that you fill the bag with the medicine, that it be scalded according to the quantity of the tolerance of the patient; and guard yourself that it be not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then the patient be supine on his back, and elevate his legs up and place below him a cushion on which already are the men or a cushion; and then anoint the extremity of the cautery with oil or with egg white or with mucilage of fennel or of similes; and then insert that into the anus with facility, and then the minister takes the bag and expresses that with two hands and at the same time with vehemence until it be evacuated in the bowels all that which is in the christening; and then extract the christening and the patient lifts his legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces that as well as, have the as much as it can; and if it sleeps with that for a whole night, it is more later in help.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you cauterize that in the illnesses of solution of belly and the expulsion of it the coity, then you iterate the cautery until it be healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the anus be hemorrhoids or abscesses leading, then be the christening much subtle and lion, of the christenings with which the children are christened.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Of the cure of the plagues.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	And I have already said in the division of the cure of the plagues what was convenient to the book, and I say thus the cure of those with my hand and with medicines according to the complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore I say that the plagues are diversified according to what in which they are made the plagues and according to the place on which fall the plagues.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which many times are made the plagues so as by a blow of a stone, or incision of a sword or of a spear, or percussion with a lance, or with a club, or with an arrow, or similes to those of many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But the plagues that are in the places of the body are like the plague that falls upon the head, or the neck, or the feet, or the belly, or the arm, and resemble those of the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And you are considering the cure of some plagues so that you pause that reasoning and rule over the other plagues.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And you begin with the plagues of the head simple, because the remembrance of the composed will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, I say that when a simple plague occurs in the head and it is not a fracture, then consider: if it is due to a gem or a similar thing, and the bone has been broken only slightly and it is a large plague and you fear a boil on that patient, then you take care and immediately perform cephalic flebotomy, and do not delay this; and extract from that of the blood according to the quantity of its virtue, if no other cause prohibits flebotomy, especially if the blood that is drawn from the plague is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And it is the flebotomy of the opposite side of the afflicted part; and guard the patient from repletion and from wine and from heavy food.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if from the little [amount of blood] some cause prohibits, then let the food be lessened and do not approach meat nor wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And place on the plague, if a boil occurs there, a cloth infused in rose oil or in wine in which is stippled.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if it is certain of a boil, then place on the plague, if it is recent, its blood and the air has not changed that powder which I will recommend soon.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that, then place on [a poultice] of herbs until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the plague is large or is due to a cut of space and similar things, and the lips of it are not adjusted by sutures, then adjust those with sutures according to what I will recommend of the sutures of them.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the plague is already uncovered of the bone and skin, and it is not a retention of it but a small suspensory, then incise that and then cure the plague with medicines and restore the flesh to the place of the bone, and command the patient to be cautious of foods in which there is heaviness: caps and forms cooked and similar to them, until it is composed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if it rots in the bone and does not adhere to the bone, then you incise all that pus and throw it out, and then cure that.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these plagues an artery or vein from which blood flow can come, and it is not severed by medicines, then you inquire about the artery, and if you find that not incise, then you incise that with a spatula, or cauterize it; and if necessity provokes that what we have said does not confer, then you cauterize until the blood is severed.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these plagues are simple and small, then the cause of them is light;  in this way that you pulverize on those this powder, because consolidated that before the air changes them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: receive olive oil, one part, of dragon's blood, two parts, of cautery, three parts; all be ground and sifted, and of this, fill the plague, and be constricted by good constriction until it well adheres on it, and be coagulated with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then strengthen that with poultices and leave it, and do not unbind it while it is thus, so that no medicine is extracted from it until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And some times do this alone cautery, when it is not to you in present olive oil and dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And already do this same operation in the great plagues when it convenes that it be placed on those and they be tightened, and so plagues recent with their blood, which the air has not altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is in summer time, then it is not understood in the position of this powder, but rather cure those with what we have said, in this way that you place on those some digested herbs, or that you place on those powder of barley flour with water and honey until they get a poultice; and then cure those with the other cure until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if a plague occurs with a fracture in the bone, and it is small, then you extract that with a  [surgical] instrument.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I say the cure of the fractures of the head in that which is venomous.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the plagues of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the plague occurs in the neck, then there is no difference in medication, and between the plague of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerve of the neck is incised or the artery, then if it is a nerve, it is not in it, but that its cure with what does vehement cauterization is avoided, like ziniar and zegi that is vitriol and similar to them because they are harmful to the nerves and contract that.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not place on the plague any cause of all cold, because the substance of the nerves is cold and the continuation of it is with the brain, which is the most delicate of all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is cured with medicines light, such as it is washed with sweet water, some herb infused in rose oil or non-rose oil, and thucia when it is washed with sweet water and the other herbs minced according to this manner, and humid herbs.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the wound is large, then administer suture, or tie the lips of it, and then care for it with powders until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound is deep or an accident has occurred in it to the lower part, then perforate that in the most depressed location.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if in the wound an artery has already been incised and there is a flow of blood, then separate or tie it off, or cauterize it if necessary to stop it.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the thyroid cartilage has already been incised or all of it, and the veins of the neck are saved, then you adjust the lips of the larynx with suture over the trachea and do not touch that; elevate that and reduce it to its natural form, and then strengthen that with a decent structure, and leave that for several days; and then care for that with ointments in which there is styptic and excitation until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound has already been made in the bone, then strike that, and if there are fragments of bone in it, extract all those that you can; and what to you is not apparent, leave that until the wound is purified, and it is separated and the discharge from it is relieved.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the wound is recent, then pulverize over that the powder which has been recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if a fistula has been made in the wound, then cure that with the water of which the remembrance will come about in its chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the wounds of the neck or of similar ones when made between the ribs and is made with a knife or with a sword or with a lance or with similar.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a blow from a lance or from a sword, and sometimes from it the depth, then consider more if from the wound there is a puffiness when the patient is leaning; then you know that the wound is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if in it there is no depth and the wound is recent with its blood, then you put in it of the first hour powder, and do not strengthen that so that it is not the blood retained in the depth of it and that it returns to the heart and that it kills the patient, but put in it an attractive ointment, and loosen that twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the ointment is not to you present, then you put in the orifice of the wound a piece of old cloth so that it sucks that which is of the humidities; and make that the patient sleep on the wound so that it runs what is in it adjusted.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if of the wound have passed three days or more and does not occur to the patient spasm nor tremor of heart nor stricture of the ale, and sometimes the other good dispositions of it, then you know that the wound is saved; and therefore cure that with poultices and with the other cure until it is healed.
