Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if the healing of it is excused, and already all time is open, then you know that already a fistula has been made; cure therefore that by its chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is by incision of a knife or of a sword, and is simple on the surface of the foot or of the back, then cure that with water that is preceded by suture, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if already a fracture has been made in the bone, and already from it incisions have been made, then you turn the wound and try to extract those fragments, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then leave them until the wound is purified, that the extraction of them is relieved.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other wounds accidents in the other members the judgment in cure is the judgment of water that we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the wounds of the belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition which occurs in the belly is either great, or small, or medium.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great some times there are the intestine or nerve of the intestine, for which there is made intrusion of them and the suture of them being more vehement and more subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small disruption is made difficult by another manner, and if you see that the reduction of them is more difficult, if you do not take care of the intrusion of them to their place soon, because it opens and is thickened for which the entry of it is made difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is medium, for in that one the reduction of the intestine is not difficult, as it is difficult in the two species mentioned before.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And you know that suture of the belly is according to four manners, but two sutures are common that are convenient in sutures of the other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other sutures proper communicate to the others, but however they are more proper in the suture of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to you each one with exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the wound is small and there is issued some cause from the intestine for that, and it is made difficult to reduce that, then water is in one of two manners: either by the smallness of the disruption as we have said, or when to the intestine has come inflammation because of the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when water is thus, then cove that you cleanse that as you submerge a sponge or cloth humid in tepid water, or that which you squeeze in water with squinant, and cyperum, and spic, and embrokes with that the intestine until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it is done with a liquid in which there is a coagulant, and it is better than water alone in resolving inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore, when you see the inflammation being resolved, then you moisten the intestine with water in which is added alum and mallows, because by this it is relieved the pain of it with little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the pain of it is not relieved by this cure, then you split the rupture a little with an instrument with which hemorrhoids are incised.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first cure is better, when it is owned that it is not a section, and it is not occupied to dry it up except by necessity and weakness.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, this is the shape of it:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of it is sharp, and the other part is not sharp, and the tip is fine, and it is not as fine as a spatula, rather it is blunt a little.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore, when the hernia is amplified and goes out the intestine, then cover that its reduction be according to the form of its natural, in its proper place, if it is possible, because it is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the rupture is wide, and it is in the lower part of the belly, then cover that you make the patient lie on his back, and place his legs higher than his head; and if it is in the lower part of the belly, then you place his head and feet higher than the parts in between.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly, if the rupture is in one of the two parts of the belly, then place your attention and your consideration always in this way so that the part in which the hernia is is higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus cover that you administer this in large hernias and in medium hernias.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small hernias, place that which is prepared by you, and have it ministered between your fingers, which have the rupture all with its hand and adjust the lips of it, and then uncover from that to that which sees the suture any cause to another.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the manner of common suturing: one that you take the needle, or count of needles according to the quantity of the amplitude of the hernia; and then lay it from the extremity of the rupture of the ring finger, and strengthen the needle one, or another that you do not put thread in the two extremities of the cord, with two extremities of the chisel that is below the cord of the parts, until you make that penetrate from that part; and you have already added two extremities of the cord and two extremities of the chisel, and so are made four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then strengthen with double thread in the circuit of the needle, and sometimes of two parts together, and then add the two lips and the hernia by decent addition; and then lay the thickness of the finger and fix another needle in that, and then tie that with thread as you tied with the first needle; and do not cease to do this if it is necessary with the needles until you have completed the whole constriction of the hernia.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the needles be medium between thickness and fineness, because the fine needles lightly cut the flesh; and the thick ones are of difficult entrance in the cord, and therefore by this cover that they be medium in fineness and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And do not cover that the needle be placed in two extremities of the cord properly not, so that the flesh not be lightly cut and that the hernia be healed before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not be prolonged sutures so that the hernia be not prohibited from consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then cut the extremities of the needles so that they do not lead the patient of his sleep; and place over the suture powders expanded of all parts, which have the extremities of the needles; and leave those until you know that the hernia is already consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this kind of suturing with needles in this manner is most convenient in small hernias, because it suffices in the suturing of them one needle or two or around those.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second suturing is common: and it is that you administer with suturing the four extremities, of the cord and two extremities of the chisel, in one time, with a needle in which thread is enveloped equal in fineness and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And when with the needle you have penetrated these four extremities, reduce the needle from that same part from which you commenced, so that the thread retracted is drawn from the most superior part of the hernia, so that the suturing be according to the suturing of cloth with which the cloths are tightened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And pause between each suturing the quantity of the thickness of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suturing saves the men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with this suturing I cured the hernia which was afflicted to a man in his belly which was plagued with a knife, and the disruption of the hernia was greater than a palm, and it was issued from the bowels around two palms of the bowel of the middle place and was the disruption in the middle of the member; and therefore I reduced that after the bowel had been pierced by the hernia for 24 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the hernia was consolidated in the space of 15 days or around, and I cured that one and he is healed; and then that is visible for many years, and it is converted in its dispositions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other doctors had judged that it would not be healed; and by miracle fire, because I did not cure that wound with an ointment, because it was in a place where the ointment was not found nor any medicine, but I placed over the wound a clean cloth twice a day and constant washing with honey water until it healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I say two kinds of sutures proper according to the narration of Scripture.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And that you begin with the suture of the tendon, and introduce the needle from the front part to the back part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And therefore, as the needle penetrates the tendon and in that middle laceration according to rectum and length of the whole body, and leaves the extremity of the thread in which you have introduced the needle; and make it penetrate in the other extremity the needle from the back part to the front part in the other extremity of the body.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And therefore, as you have made that penetrate, then you make that penetrate another time in that same extremity of the body from the front part to the back part; and leave the extremity of the thread that is in this place, and make the needle penetrate in the other extremity from the back part to the front part.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make it penetrate with that one the penetration with which you make that penetrate in the thread in the extremity of the body which is in that part while all that penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then, as you begin from this same side and sew with the extremity that is of the thread in the other place, and extract the needle from the tendon which penetrated, and then reduce that one in that tendon and body the extremity of the thread that is in the other side with this extremity of the body; and extract that one from the tendon which is of that part.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this one time and another, and do this one time next another until you sew all that is in front according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this manner of suturing is that you sew with suture of the skin with which you sew the hairs, in this way that you sew the thread one time from the part of the extremity of the tendon, and that you leave that other time within while you make it complete.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second kind of proper suture which I call Gualia, and this is of the service of it and by it recommended, is that you sew that one according to similarity with which some medicants sew that one, in this way that they join all part to its corresponding part to it convenient by nature; and apply the extremity of one of it and the extremity of the body to the other extremity of it, and this is done according to what you to me recommend.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Since you put the needle in the extremity of the body to your own from the front part, and make that penetrate to the back part in that same one, and leave two extremities of the thread; and then you revolve the needle and make that penetrate from front to back in two extremities of the thread.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then you revolve those each one, and make each one penetrate from the back part into the front part in two extremities of the body others that are in the opposite place.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suturing is better than the common lighter suturing, and is the suturing of which I preceded memory.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the service of Gualia
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And yet some, they say, suture of the belly is rectified with two needles, so that you introduce in these each one a thread, and begin with introduction of the needle of that which you owe to you, and make that penetrate into the other place according to suturing of those with which they sew the skins equally.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when disruption is in the middle place of the belly, then the suturing of it is more difficult than of the other places of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the judgment of medication of plague is judgment of the other plagues.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	Which cause is because when you obtain the plague recent with its blood before the air alters that one, and reduce the intestine and sew that one and fit that one decently, then you pause on that carnation powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then you pause on that some ointments which are to your presence while they make hard and break the threads, and be consolidated thread and body; and then cure that thus as is the cure of the other plagues while it be healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if to you are not present the medicines, then you pause on that immediately, because it begins to throw brac, clean cloth, and change that two times a day, thus as to you and taught, while it be healed, because you do not indigested of other medication in many dispositions when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the plague communicate in lesion to the principal members, then you must submerge linen leon in oil of good quality, or in rose oil, and pause that one in the circuit of the places that are between the angles and leave the aysselas.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if you feel pain or putrefaction in their bowels, because many times that one must, then cauterize that one with black stiptic wine, and more so if the perforation is arrived in the bowel and is made exitura penetrating into the concavity of it.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that the one which is of the large bowel is of less healing than the one which is in the subtile bowels.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the hernia, which is called “gegunu”, does not receive healing from the plague that comes upon it from all; and this is because of the great multitude of veins that are in it and because of the magnitude of it that is in those, and because of the subtlety of the body of that, and because of the proximity of that to the nature of nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if what proceeds from the plague is the cloth, and you obtain that recently, reduce that according to your prescription, with which you reduce the hernias equally.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has passed into space and is already made green or black, then you should strengthen that with a file on the area that is discolored from it, so that blood flows, because in the cloth are veins and arteries.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	And then cut that which is other than that ligament, and place the ends of the file pending from the part where the plague has departed from it, so that over you may be relieved the attraction of it, you must the removal of the cloth and the emission of the arm of the plague.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Memorization of the plagues when they occur in the hernia.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a rupture occurs in the hernia and it is small, then it is possible that it may be restored in some men, because thus I saw one who had been plagued in his belly by a lance thrust and the hernia was on the right side of the stomach, and the hernia was old and made a fistula, and it was easy for him to manage and windy.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Therefore, I thought about the cure of him since he was not confident in the healing of him, but I continued to subtly treat him until the inside was healed and the place was consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I saw that the place was already consolidated, I put on the patient that he should not fall again into the accident of evil in his belly; and do not fall into any evil accident and remain in his usual dispositions of eating and drinking, and then enter into baths and he is exercised in his limbs.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And already some experienced ones have said that when a hernia occurs in the belly, and it is small, then it is necessary that it be tied according to this manner: and it is that you take splints of large heads; and then adjust the two lips of the hernia and place a splint of those that has the mouth open on the two lips of the hernia; therefore when it takes over those and strengthens its mouth, cut off its head, because it adheres and is not dissolved.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	And then place another splint near the first one, and do not cease to do this with splints one near another according to the quantity of the whole hernia.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	And then reduce the hernia and keep those annexed heads in the belly until the hernia is healed; and do not happen to the patient any harm.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is already possible that the hernia may be tied with a subtle file which is made of the skin of an animal annexed to it, because it is more in a needle; and it is that you take the extremity of those files of skin, and it be well skinned, and then tie the extremity of it with a file of linen, enveloped, and then introduce that file in needles and go with it into the hernia, and reduce it in the rupture.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this manner of suturing with splints is nothing but according to a way of trust and of hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the hernia is large and wide, mostly if it is in one of the subtle hernias, because then it is not born but subtlety, and it is not healed of it at all.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of the cure of  fistula and abscess.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that every hernia and abscess when it is inflamed and gets old, and is made an ulcer, and is not consolidated and throws out pus all the time and is not cut off, then, in whatever member it may be, universally it is called a fistula and we call that one a zuchem.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And fistula according to truth is a fibrous, hard, white nodule, with which there is no pain and which has a concavity like the concavity of a bird's bone; and for this reason, that one is called by some "rizatz", that is, bone.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And it is in some men moist, the one that throws out pus; and very quickly the moisture is cut off in some hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture is moved, and it is little, and it is thick, and it is subtle.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already said in the division, then as I said the hernias, that every ulcer that is not healed nor is in its naked flesh, is not this but for one of these causes: of which one is or because of a lack of blood in the body; or because of its malice; or because between it and the lips is hard flesh prohibiting the birth of flesh; or because it is of moving legesa; or because that ulcer in itself puts itself in a state of decay and the matter that is sent to it is of bad quality; or because the medicine is inconvenient in its cure; or when corruption catches in the region, and it is pestilence; or by the property of the region as it happens in Zaragoza, in which it is made difficult digestion of the ailments, and it is delayed in that healing of the abscess by nature; or because in it there is a bone, or moving bones.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have already shown all those causes, and their symptoms and the cure of them with medicines in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And therefore I want to make you know the cure of fistula which is done by the way of operation with the hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And know that fistulas occur in all the members of the body; for some of these are fistulas that reach the large veins and arteries, or the nerves, or the brain, or the intestine, or the bladder, or any of the ribs, or any of the vertebrae of the spine, or any of the joints composed by composition as if from the hand and the foot; and of these, those that give to it proximity of the principal member and of resemblances.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And therefore of these fistulas that are according to this manner are of the diseases of difficult healing, and no receive cure, and occupation with that is work and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if it is of the fistulas some the depth of which does not reach these places that have been said, and you wait and trust in the cure of it, and you want to arrive at knowledge of it, then take the attempt of the thread or of iron, and if the fistula goes according to rectum, and inquire that with it.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is tortuosity, then investigate that with a thread of subtle lead, for lead with the lightness of its body is eased and curved of its tortuosity.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula is having moist horrors, it is not to you possible that you signify upon it with thread.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Therefore, cleanse the orifice by its orifices, for the humidity by which you cleanse it should go from the other orifices and run from them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then inquire exquisitely, according to what manner to you is it possible that you know if here has the bone or the nerve, and is the concavity of the fistula distant or proximate, or is a fistula to which there are moist orifices and this over all with the sum of your strength, with your interrogation, with which you interrogate the patient, and the invention of the pain you must compress it with your hand over the place, and resemblances of the significations and of the causes accidental to the abscess.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And as you will have stood upon all those causes with true station, then come to the cure according to confidence: and it is that you consider then if the fistula apparent is proximate or in a salty place, distant from a joint, or of a nerve, or of an artery, or of a vein, or of one of the places which I have told you.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then you dry the fistula according to that which has been said before of the narration of it, and remove that which is in that filtration and of corrupted flesh, and that which is born in the orifice of the flesh, or of the heel and of resemblances, and cure that until it is healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is of distant depth, and is according to rectum, then cover that which you have incised in the preon as much as to you is possible, and then modify that of all its corrupted flesh; and then administer poultices enveloped in sharp medicines, and introduce those into the concavity of the fistula, which you have understood with iron.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this with that some times until the sharp medicine corrodes all that which is rotten in the concavity of the fistula from the corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore that with ointments which generate healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by that, then you cauterize that according to that which we have recounted.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is bone and it is due to you to certify that, then you inquire about it and dry it according to that which we have recounted, if you do not prohibit any cause of vein or of nerve or of principal member as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is to you discovered and there is in it any corruption and blackness, then you cut that until the corruption is hosted all; and then cure that with that which it encarves into it until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and casts a brac as it was doing, then know that you have not arrived at the total eradication of the corruption; and therefore you uncover over it secondarily and exquisitely do the reason of it and the purification of it with the posterior strength of your, and then restore that.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And therefore if it is healed, well is; and if not, then know that that corruption is in the distant depth of the body, which you have not achieved, and therefore in that you can only engender to leave it.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small, or it is to you possible to pull that, then you pull it with subtle forceps which are convenient to that.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then exquisitely do the extraction of all those, and of those leave no cause with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if to you makes contrariety any cause of the humidities, and in them incision there is no fear nor error, then incise those ligaments or flesh if they are here, and deliver the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if to you is not preparation to remove the bones of your hour, then pause over the plague that which you can put on the plague that, and leave it until that is around those bones of flesh and of ligaments, and guard the plague that it not be consolidated, and be constricted the section which you have incised in your operation.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Having, if you fear, pause over it a cloth submerged in sopre trissat with oil, or a cloth submerged in Egyptian ointment, or in some of the green ointments, for when they will putrefy those ligaments, and the bones are of their separation the ablation, and of those attraction is eased.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone, such as the thigh bone or hip bone, or similar to those, and what is corrupted of it is only the surface of it, then remove that with a scalpel only as far as the blackness and corruption remain, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if what is corrupted of it is a large portion, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that and to cut into the area where the corruption has reached, and then cure it from within until it is consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend to you that you make a man in his thigh to place that as an example and assistant on your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	Take a young man around xxx years old, who has an accident in his thigh, and from the parts of his body, the badness is on the matter of the body until the matter has reached the thigh, and it is matter of abscess with a large abscess, and it is not from an external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And therefore take the time with that for the error of the doctors until the abscess is opened, and there appear many materials from it, and its cure is then stopped until the thigh is fistulated, and make in it many horrible wounds which all throw out pus and the humidities of the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And therefore the cure took many years of doctors for two years, and in those I was not wise but in the art, until I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw the thigh of him and the materials that ran from those horrible wounds for a great body; and already the body of that man was all stiff and the color of it was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And therefore I inserted the probe into one of those wounds and reached the bone with it.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then I examined all the wounds and found that they reached to all parts of the thigh.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I cut myself and incised upon one of the wounds where I described a part of the bone, and I found that corrupted, and it was already terrible and corrupted and degraded; and a part of the thigh was already corrupted where it had penetrated into the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I sewed that which was discovered to me and prepared of the uncovered bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I cured that it was not in the bone but that corruption which I excised and sewed, and I had already removed it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I placed the restoration of the wound with consolidative medicines for a long time, and it was not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I repeated and discovered upon the bone secondarily upon the first discovery, and I found continuous corruption with the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I sewed that which appeared to me of that corruption, and then I was perforated making the cure of it and restoration, and it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I discovered upon it another time and did not cease to incise the bone little by little particularly and perforated the restoration of it, and it was not restored until I incised around one palm of it, and that I extracted with its marrow, and then I restored that with medicines, and it was consolidated slightly and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And it was not necessary to iterate in the operation of him and the section of him, but for the disposition of the frailty of him and for the scarcity of his tolerance and fear of death, because to him it happened in all hours for superfluity of evacuation syncope evil.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And therefore he was healed by entire healing, and nothing was in place of bone, hard flesh; and good disposition was made of him in his body and returned the virtue of him; and he was converted in his dispositions and did not do to him contrariety in walking nor harm in any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is prominent in the place of the body already, then when you cut that according to this manner: and that you take a ligament and strengthen that in the extremity of that prominent bone, and command to someone that extends that upwards; and place that ligament of wool thicker than the first ligament; and then tie that over the flesh that is left of the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you draw the flesh to the parts below, and you uncover the flesh over the place which you want to sew so that the saw does not damage the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a board or table below the bone decently, for when you do this it is not forbidden that the saw does not cut the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And cover that it be the sawing upon the corrupted place little by little, for if it is in the concavity of the bone corruption and does not appear in its appearance to the feeling, and force the sawing of it another time.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted and not prominent, it abates one part continued with the other, and the corruption is in the middle place or in a part of it, then you uncover the flesh of all parts entirely; and then place a board below, and then saw that of the first part where the corruption is until the sawing is continued of the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And be the sawing according to the place of the corruption a little, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, incise that corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it is continued from the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in it reason but ingenuity.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the chest of the hand or the foot, it is very difficult; however, since you inquire about the corruption in what manner it appears to you, and that you open it, and cleanse it according to each disposition which is possible to you, and in case it is rectified to you, when it does not cause you contrariety vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know which are the saws and the instruments to cut these bones are very according to the situation of the bones, and the preparation of those, and the thickness of those, and the subtlety and the greatness and the smallness of those, and the hardness and their rarity; for that whenever you prepare for every kind of operation instrument convenient to that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that that operation signifies to you about the kind of instrument of which you indigeysses; when with you is great study and long and knowledge of the ways of this art, and testimony of ways of diseases, for the hours you already have by you yourself that which is convenient to them of the instruments to every disease.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And you so to you forming at the end of this chapter the number of instruments the ones which you will put as simple with the ones which you will proceed to your prohibition the one which you will experiment on the others.
Forma de serra:	Shape of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Shape of another large saw:
Forma de ray:	Shape of a chisel:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this chisel be according to the shape of the head of a star-shaped key, and the points of it be according to the shape of the points of an awl.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not convenient except that with that [the chisel] the heads of the joints be confricadatz when they are corrupted, or it is the wide mouth.

Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another incisor; this one resembling a chisel, and the extremity of it is like a saw, and it is exhibited in many places in the ratio of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a chisel which is convenient for the ratio of that which is perforated of the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the extremity of it is triangular and of an acute extremity.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly as all the causes that we have said of razors and incisors and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision extremities and of the serration of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities can be severed either by an intrinsic cause or by an extrinsic cause, or as you will have medicated that corruption for the cure of those medicines and the cure does not confer, or sometimes the corruption goes from the limb which you do not strike any cause, then when you incise that limb into that the hon, the corruption, so that the patient escapes through that of death or malice which is a greater defect of the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that to whom it happens, is that the limb is made black before it is cured that fire has already burned it, or it can be said the blackness before the putrefaction of that one enters into that limb that seizes it and that nourishes the whole body; and therefore you should take care to incise that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly if it is a cause of corruption by percussion of some venomous causes as well as from a sea scorpion or from a viper or from a rutula and of similar things.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the percussion is in the extremity of the finger, then you incise the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it may enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if it reaches the arm, then you incise it from the root of the forearm, and do not give space to the corruption so that it may nourish in the forearm of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if instead of that, then you incise the arm into the armpit at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if instead of that, the corruption passes and sometimes encircles the armpit, then in that is the death of the patient; and administer another cause another for the cure is a quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do of the foot when corruption envezeys the toe of the foot, then you incise it into one of the toes.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes in the sole of the foot, then you incise the whole foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it may enter into the thigh, then you incise the thigh into the junction of the thigh.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the thigh, then in it there is no remedy but dismissal, and leave the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the manner of incising the limb or of sawing it is that you tighten a ligament in the part farthest from where you want to incise, and tighten another ligament over the place; and extend the minister a ligament to the parts below, and extend the minister another ligament above; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments, a lat spatulum until all the flesh is uncovered; and then incise or saw.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And cover that it be placed cloth of it from all parts so that it does not touch the place, and that it comes to the patient lesion adjusted and abscess caut.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if blood flows when working, then you cauterize the place carefully, or place on it some powders that restrain the blood; and then return to your medication until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the affected limb to the one convenient, and cure that until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you that which happens to a man in his foot, this same accident which I have told you, which is that blackening occurs in his foot with a burn that was assembled to the burning of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption occurs first in his toe before it extends to the whole foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And therefore that man prepares for himself to put pus that the cure may go to the member with the vehemence of it that throbs with pain and burning of it, and the incision that foot into the joint, and fire heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long time occurs that same corruption in the toe of the hand I indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And therefore it comes to me, and so I am pierced to repercuss that superfluity with what I place on the hand of the medicines, then the purification of the body of him; and it does not repercuss the superfluity and it begins to go to the other toe before it begins in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he begs me to cut his hand, and I do not want to do that, hoping on the repercussion of that superfluity, and more that I fear the incision of his hand would be dead, for the virtue of the patient was over the case.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he departed from me, he returned to his land and it reached me that that man prepared and cut his hand entirely, and it healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this narration except so that it may be an assistant on that which catz of this illness, and that its signification for which it is signified and according to which it is worked.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the cure of sinews and the quality of clysterization with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshy members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it makes a collection of pus, and then it is broken and perforated, and pus is issued from it, and the place remains empty as if it were a vessel, and the skin that is above it as if it were fine cloth, and it has not reached the back corruption, and it has not imprinted on the bone or on the nerve or on the ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not called a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But however, if the space is prolonged until the corruption impinges on some member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure of it is that the skin is incised entirely as if it were turned over, and mostly when it is fine and made like cloth, and comfizas that it does not adhere to the place by its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the skin adheres and that that corruption has not achieved further consequence, and in the skin has passed through a face, then you cure that with clysters.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the sinus, and then if it is large, and the brac that you see is of a fetid odor, then you clysterize that with an Egyptian medicine which is of oil and wine and vinegar receiving equal parts, and they are placed in a vessel, and they are boiled over the fire until the medicine becomes thick and reaches the consistency of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take from it what is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; and clysterize with that the sinus, and strengthen the orifice of it, and leave the medicine in it for the quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then extract that with a sponge; and do this for so many days until the sinus is purified and the stench is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And some times it is clysterized with water of ashes, when the medicine is not present to you; and it is that you take the ashes of vitz, and put water on it; and then boil that and clysterize with it until you confess that the sinus is then healed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient does not have tolerance on the Egyptian medicine nor the water of ashes, then clysterize that with water and honey and that it be mixed with vinegar, and clysterize that with wine and honey mixed, for by property of honey is that it purifies and washes, and the wine makes the sinus adhere, and especially when in the wine there is superfluity of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And as you do this sometimes and you confess that the sinus is already healed, then clysterize that with water that makes flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is that you take of  dyadicon and dissolve it in rose oil and astringent wine; or that you clysterize with it some medicines and other gargles that have the properties which I have already written in the treatise of gargles.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is narrow in which the clyster's tube is not received, then you enlarge it with a small iron bit by bit, and place in it a poultice wrapped in Egyptian ointment or basilicon ointment until it is enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the orifice is wide, then you add the lips of it with suture and leave it in the quantity in which between the clyster its addition.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of him from which the arm comes is elevated to the parts above, then dry that in the lowest place that is in him so that the arm runs below, because when the arm is contracted in the depth of the sinew the flesh is generated in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinew within the environment of the bone as low as you want, then perforate that which prepares the member with the preparation by which the arm runs lightly as it is to your apparel and that no cause of the arm be retained in it.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidated medicines that are placed on the convenient sinew to that which you want extend those on a cloth of it.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth be of such a quantity as it makes the communication of the whole sinew; and then cut with scissors in the right of the orifice of the sinew a furrow wider a little than the orifice of the sinew; and then extend on another cloth of the lion's entrails according to the quantity of the furrow, and place it on that in a distant position from the orifice of the sinew so that the swelling of the arm of it be alleviated and do not expose the large cloth but after a few days once.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is on the orifice of the sinew, the which you remove at every hour so that that which is adjusted in it of the arm may escape.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know if that which runs from it of the arm is much or little, or is digested, or is not digested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And thus you consider the place of that sinew, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if there is an abscess in it.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And as your medication is prolonged in this manner, and you see the matter that is thrown on the orifice of the sinew already adheres, or approximates adherence, then the third day you untie it, and when you untie the bandage, then change the cloth for another and renew the enguent.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinew a proper space appears virus subtle, then do not despair of its adherence, because the healing of it approaches, because in some men in which slow generation of flesh in their wounds, and of those so in which is done the contrary of it.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinew after many days is issued arm indigested, then know that the sinew does not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinew is delayed and is the prolonged cause, then you adjust in drying of the medicines, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they are dried as in a diaphana enguent, when in it is adjusted superfluity of addition of zegi.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last of which is cured, is that you take of diaphana enguent and be dissolved in rose oil, and be on it poured vi antic in its substance, and then mix that with it, and use of that.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And already it seems in that action, when there is no arm, diaphana enguent, honey when it is boiled until it is thickened, and use of it; or that you take myrrh and aloes and incense, and grind all and pulverize on the honey when it is on the fire, and then line that on cloth and stretch that on the sinew; and line that with the honey which you have boiled until it is thickened, and pulverize on cloth and stretch that.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And some times are administered with it aristolochia long and roots of celestial lily (and is celestial lily) and flour of errs and centaurea, and use of those simples or adjust, grind those and sift and pulverize on the honey which I have recommended; and use of it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinew is prolonged, and is not healed by this cure, then know that the corruption is in the depth of it, and already make inquiry in the bones or in the other hard members or in the ligaments; then you cure it with fistular cure, as above is said.
