E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And place the cloth and strengthen over the support the arm so that the arm be in place of stars, if nothing prohibits this from the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use of stars.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that you place over the fracture that star that be more wide and more strong of the other stars; and place between each star the width of the finger, and be the length of the stars according to the fracture with an addition of three fingers of all part.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then strengthen over the stars with the stricture which I have said at the beginning of the chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And it is that your stricture over the place of the fracture be more strait.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And as much as is lengthened the fracture be the stricture less.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And therefore if you see the situation of the stars and the stricture as we have said in the hour in which you restore the limb to its situation, then you do.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear abscess caut, then you loosen the stricture and the stars within the seventh day as we have said.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the ligature in all parts for three days so that nothing happens in the place proximate or inflammation; or it is prohibited the food to come to the limb by disposition of superfluity of stricture; and therefore rectify all that according to what we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are upon confidence that nothing happens from any of this, then do not untie the ligature until after three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And be the sleep of the patient on his back, and his hands on his stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place over the support a cushion full of wool, and consider in all hour of the night or of the day that not be untied nor dissolved the figure of the broken limb, or that be the ligature softened, therefore rectify that all with your virtue.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And place the food of the patient according to the order which we have before said, in such a way that the food be subtle at the beginning until it is begun to strengthen; and then it is covered that you make the food of him thicker.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	Because of custom of the support and of the bed of him it is that they be strengthened in forty days; and then it is covered that they be untied and be administered bath and be medicated with unguents those which rectify that.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is laid rubbed, then you do not untie from that the ligature and the stars within the days or within two months.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Of the restoration of a fracture of the arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones which are called two radius; of which one is small, and that is the one that lies the thumb, and the other is large and that is the one that is placed below the small finger, from the side more toward the back.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And very often is broken the major radius alone, or the small one, and very often they are broken together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when is broken the small radius above, then the restoration of it is lighter, and the healing of it is lighter.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when is broken the radius of it below the fracture of it is bad, and the healing of it is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And worse of that is when the two bones are broken together.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore if the bone which is broken is the small radius above, then it is convenient to the physician, it is necessary the restoration of it, that place a small extension with ease until that be bound.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	But if the large radius is that which is broken, then it is covered that place extension more vehement.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if the two radii are together broken, then it is covered that you place the extraction more strong.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And it is covered that you place the figure of the hand in the restoration of it and the extension of it extended over a cushion, and be the wrist of the hand to the parts above, more out than all the other fingers, and the little finger be lower of the other fingers, and the patient be centered on a well-fallen chair.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And place a cushion in front of them in the height or upright position of them, so that the patient does not move or work.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	Then the minister extends the arm of the party further back with his hand or bandage, and another minister extends it upwards seemingly.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	Then the doctor aligns the bones as much as he reduces that according to the best figure that he can.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if in the fracture of the bones there are splinters, then you must perforate to reduce all pieces in their place with your virtue.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if there appears in it a splinter separated that pierces the tendon and it is not to your hope in the restoration of it, then you must cut over it and remove it according to the manner which we have said above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	But if the fracture is with a plaque, I have already made a singular account of this, and therefore take the cure of this.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if an abscess occurs at the beginning of your restoration, then you line a cloth with cerot made of olive oil and white wax, and it is midway between thickness and subtlety, and strengthen the cloth over it with a subtle structure so that the abscess is yielded; and then remove the cerot and place an emplastre prepared of powder of barley with the white of an egg, and then place stars; and let the star be the one which is placed over that fracture more wide and more strong.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And know that the number of the stars of the arm are six in the major dispositons, or whether the fracture is in one focus or in two foci together.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	And then place your structure over the place of the fracture most strong and most vehement, and when more it is applied to the parts above the fracture or to the parts below it, place the structure a little more soft according to how it is preceded the remembrance of it in the beginning of the chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the cloths that are enveloped over the fracture should be soft and moist cloths, and not hard or rough, and the thread with which it is strengthened should be of its own proper thickness between subtle and coarse, as we have recounted.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	And consider the limb and the ligament after a few days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if there occurs any cause for which rectification is necessary, as if the swelling which occurs to the limb, and then you must immerse the limb in warm water until that swelling ceases.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And let the limb not be constricted until it rests, and then return the structure.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the structure is already softened and the bone is already remade and seems like those, then rectify all of it with your virtue.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	And consider more if the nourishment is prohibited to reach the limb by superfluity of structure, for then you must soften that a little and let it for a few days until it runs to that the nourishment, and then strengthen it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	But if the patient does not occur any of those causes that we have said, then he must not be untied for about 20 days or thereabouts.
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	And then let the arm of the patient be suspended by its own virtue of movement agitation, and make him sleep on his back.
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	And know that this fracture is restored in 30 days or 32 days, or at most it is restored in 28 days, and all of it is according to the disposition of the complexities and the dispositions of the virtue.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the wrist and the fingers.
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	Know that at the wrist and the joints of the fingers, the fracture is rare, and it does not occur to them except for many blows.
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	And when a fracture or a sprain occurs to the hand, then the patient must follow the same as before, and place the hand of him over that extended one.
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	And then the minister extends the broken bones and the doctor aligns them until they are conjoined with good conjunction.
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	And then you must place an emplastre and cotton wool, if no abscess occurs; and then place stars above according to the quantity of the place, and you have already enveloped it in a cloth of it.
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	But if the fracture is in the parts of the fingers of the palm, and then make a semblance of a sphere of cloth, and command the patient to strengthen it with his fractured palm; then it should be strengthened with a long cloth.
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	And let the star be of leather with cloth in which it is elevated, so that the leather is applied to the palm; and strengthen it according to what you must.
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	But if the fracture is in the outer parts, then you must place stars above and another star from the underside in the palm, so that the hand is open and straight; and then place the structure, as if the hand is revolved to the wrist between the fingers with ligaments.
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	And if a fracture occurs to any of the joints of the fingers, then if the finger is put straight, it should be aligned as you must, and then it should be strengthened with the palm, and if you want, place a small straight star to it so that the fracture is elevated and not harmed.
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	But if the fracture is in the other fingers, as in that of the middle location, or in the index, or in the ring finger, or in the little finger, then it should be aligned and tied with the finger that is adjacent to it; or they should all be tied according to continuity, and it is better; or place a small star on it, as we have said in the thumb.
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	And consider, in your restoration, and around that, the disposition of abscess cautery and oppose — in your operation — to what happens when any cause of those occurs, according to how the story of it is repeated.
Capitol .xiv.	Chapter XIV.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	Of the restoration of a fracture of the bone of the thigh.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bone of the thigh, when broken, is declared to the feeling according to how it is converted to the part in front and the most sovereign pus.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	And the restoration of it is done in such a way that the ligament is tightened over the fracture and another ligament is left below the fracture, and the patient is prone on their belly and face.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	And then the minister extends all the ligament to its part according to the quality, when the fracture is in the middle part of the bone.
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	But if it is proper to the root of the thigh, then the ligament is proper to the denolh to the part of the pentenilh, so that the extension is placed in its, and the other ligament below the fracture.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	And similarly if the fracture is proper to the denolh, then the ligament is made proper to the denolh, and the extension is to the parts below.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	And then the doctor aligns the bone with both of its hands until it is reduced according to the natural resemblance and the bone is joined by a good connection; then cover that with plaster and constriction, if no abscess occurs to the limb.
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	But if an abscess occurs in it, then you leave that for some days until the abscess cautery is yielded, and then return to your cure.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The constriction of it is made thus: cover that over the fracture a hard bandage, and double that two or three times, and remove from it the superfluity; and then envelop the leg until it reaches the talo and the root of the thigh.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	And introduce long felt between the thigh and the leg proper from the denol to the parts below, and the extremities of the felt come from the part most sovereign of the two parts, and then roll over the leg and thigh what superfluity of the bandage.
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	And then place over the thigh in the place of that fracture splints, and place from those a splint over the bone of the leg.
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	And then fill the vacancies between the leg and the thigh with soft cloths, so that the constriction is coagulated.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	And then begin with strong constriction of the middle over the place of the fracture with three or four wrappings, and as much as you go away with the ligament from the place of the fracture, your constriction be smaller and more lighter and softer.
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	And then extend the two extremities of the felt to the parts below until it reaches the ankle of the foot, and tighten both extremities of the splints on the other part so that the ligament is not removed from its place.
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	And then leave the constriction on that, so that it does not occur to the limb corrosion or abscess cautery or inflammation and resemblances to those; and if any cause of those occurs, then cut yourself from it, and rectify what occurs all, according to what we have said many times.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	But if in the bone is heavy of the bone which puts, then cover that according to what is possible to you; and if not, finish on it and remove that, and cure with what precedes the recollection until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	And sometimes this fracture of the thigh is tightened another thing that are adjusted to it splints, as we have said in the adjutori and in the arm.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	But however in the restoration of it in such a manner made, do not occur to the patient claudication; and if it is restored alone, another thing that is applied to the other leg, then it is necessary that he claudicates that of which it is always.
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	And know that the thigh is tightened in 40 days or a few months or a few less, and all that is according to the diversity of the complexities and of the other dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the kneecap of the thigh.
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	Know that fracture of the kneecap of the thigh is hard to endure, but it occurs to it many times attrition.

But if it occurs to it fracture, then it is not but fissure or crack in its parts, and that is with plague or ses plague, and over that all is established with the feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	And the restoration of it is in such a way that it is aligned what is broken of its parts with the ditz until it is aggregated and joined according to what is possible by equation and facility and fabrication.

And then consider all the dispositions which we have recommended in the other fractures, as abscess cautery and semblance to those in such a way that it opposes to all accidents to what is convenient until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the leg.
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	Know that in the leg there are two bones of which one is thick, and it is named by the name of the tibia; and the other is subtle, and it is named fibula.
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	And consider the case of a fracture of this kind which occurs to the two bones of the arm, and by this, restoration of it is made as well as restoration of the arm equally, and the operation of it is one.
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	And if two bones are broken together, the leg is converted to all parts.
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	And if the most delicate bone is broken, the leg is converted to the parts in front.
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	And if the thickest bone is broken, that one is left behind, and it is of those causes that are not to your liking.
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	And then administer extension and equation and ligation of the splints according to that same alignment.
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	However, keep in mind, if the fracture of the leg is slight and has many stages, that the extension be less and lighter, and alleviate with your virtue.
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	And in the leg there is some cause for operation on the arm, and it is when you align the stars and that completes your whole operation, then you will take pieces of wood of pine, which is placed under the causes which are placed in soles, and are made from branches of palm; some of those which are of small thickness, and not of the hand, and the length of them according to the length of the leg, and from the bone to the very end.
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	And then envelope over each piece in two envelopes according to their length, and place one over the part of the leg on one side and the other on the other side, and be from the bone to the very lowest part of the foot.
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	And then tie the two splints in three places of two extremities and to the middle place, because with this structure the leg is prohibited from bending to the right and left part, and it stands for good station.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	And now a splint of wood has been administered according to the length of the leg; and it is placed on it so that it preserves that movement.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	And most importantly, that you do this in a fracture, and when with that it is properly called a plague.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And then consider every day the leg and study with it by further study, and you guard it from abscess and inflammation or other similar causes; and as any of those causes occurs, then oppose yourself to it with what is necessary so that it may be healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the talus and the bones of the foot and the like.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	To the talus, fracture does not occur at all; but to the bones of the foot, fracture occurs some times; and to the toes of the foot, very little fracture occurs, and it does not occur to them except attrition in the middle of the disposition.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if to the bones of the foot, fracture occurs and sometimes those bones be elevated above each other, then the patient places his foot on the ground prepared as if going.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And then place one foot upon that which is elevated of those bones, and then walk upon those, and press, and align those until they return to their places.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And then place plaster and stopa above, and place below the belly of the foot a small table to which there are two plastic caps.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And then strengthen that with the foot in a downward structure, because you have enveloped that with cloths and other causes of which you have indicated.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And as it passes three days or four, then you untie the ligament, because you will find the bones aligned, or broken or dislocated, and the operation in those is thus as you know.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if some toes are broken, then restore those, and align them as I and recounted to you in the restoration of the toes of the hand.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	And then place on the broken toe a splint according to the length of the toe, and be a little wider than it; and below the foot, this table which I have recounted to you, and strengthen that with a decent structure.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	But if that which is broken of the bones are two or three or more, then you place on each toe a splint of its quantity enveloped in lion cloth, and strengthen the table in the lowest part of the foot, and be standing on one of the caps of the table, the belly of the foot so that it has good retention.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is convenient for you that you do not forget that you do not consider all the causes which have been said to you in the other fractures of the accidents that we have said; and oppose yourself to every accident with what is necessary.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	Of the fracture of the hip bone of the woman and the bone of the thigh and the groin of the man.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the hip bone of the woman is broken, then make that cease in a cell lowered, and then incline that to the side of the back a little, and it be held behind.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And then the woman impales the hip with a cot, and it is made in the hip of her as if she hopes; and then the woman is concuted, and elevates the back of her little by little, because all that is thrown out until it is before the part of the hip as if she hopes and the broken bone returns.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And then place powders on the back of her, and when she wants to urinate, she removes the cot with ease and then urinates, and return that according to the manner according to which you perceived that at the beginning, and then return to her first powder.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do so for seven days or thereabouts, for that is the restoration.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take a sheep bladder and strengthen over the wound a straw tube; and introduce the whole bladder into the wound, and then blow into the tube with force until the bladder is inflated within the wound, for the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And then fill it with wool and let it stay for several days according to what we have recommended, until it is healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bones of the thigh of a man or a woman are broken, then administer in the restoration and stitching of it what we have recommended for the bone of the hip.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And what is right is not hidden in these proper fractures and that little is known, especially to him who has some study and use and understands this my book well; for that fracture signifies to you in the greatest dispositions the right way in the restoration and in the tightening of it, and therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the leg of a man when it is broken, take a bandage of wool, and put the leg in that; and then place a wrapping of cloth over it, and have it enveloped, and then leave it for three days or thereabouts, and it will be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	Of the restoration of fractures of bones when it is accompanied by a plague.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient for him to whom a fracture occurs with plague, and especially if the bone is large as is the bone of the hip or the humerus, or similar to that, that you take care and flebotomize him as soon as the conditions of flebotomy to you or testify as we have said before.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the plague flows blood, then you must take care to the retention of it as much as you pulverize over it  zegi trissat, if to you another cause is not present.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And then begin to restore the fracture in that same day, and do not prolong it, if you do not encounter an abscess.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	But if an abscess occurs, cauterize it, then you leave the restoration of it until the ninth day, until the abscess is subsided, and do not approach it on the third day and the fourth of all, for you will cause to happen bad accidents.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	But if the broken bone is prominent over the uncovered joint, then you must take care to reduce it and align it with your hands with as much ease and as little extension as possible.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if extension is not to your prepared and the alignment of it with your hands, then you reduce it with your hands with this instrument; and the instrument is made of iron, the length of which is of seven digits or eight and the width of which is according to the quantity of the plague; and for that it is necessary to the physician that he prepares of those three or four according to the quantity that you indicate to it in the cure in all species of fracture.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And let it be rounded, and let it have little thickness so that it not be bent of necessity the comprehension over it in the hour of the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And let it be of sharp extremity at which let it be margin in its extremities; and let the underside of it be of tending thickness, and of the majority of it within the parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the form of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is named in Greek “labre volentz atelarem”, so it is a little palette.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	Because it must be placed the extremity of it attends elevated over the extremity of the bone prominent.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And impel it in a single stroke until the bone returns, and it is aligned with some alignment.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And therefore strive to align the extremities of the fracture between them, and if the extremity of it broken is subtle, and does not take that the instrument for good acceptance, then you must insert the extremity of that bone until the instrument has power of it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone of all with what we have recommended, then incise it with what you convenes to it of the incisors which we have said; or saw it with one of the saws in whatever manner it is to you possible.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And then scrape that which remains in the bone of asperities and of small splinters.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And as the bone is reduced, and then the reduction the patient suffers violent pain leading, then you know that the bone is not returned to its natural place; and therefore do what you confer to the patient great help.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	As the restoration is completed which you make to the bone, and then immerse cloth in black stipt, and properly if it is in summer, and do not place over the plague cerot nor other cause in which there is oil, so that it not cause in it to happen putrefaction and corruption.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And then administer stelas in the hour of your completion of the restoration of the bone, and leave the plague uncovered as much as you incise the wound with forceps and uses of bandages according to the quantity of the plague.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And guard yourself with all caution that you do not strain the plague with the fracture, for many times have done this the foolish physicians, and have caused to happen over their patients death or illness corroding or ulcerating, so it is healed.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if your stricture is lighter, softer, different from the stricture of the other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the plague is large or the plague is bad, and you fear about that certain accidents evils the ones that we have recounted, and you feel pain in the place, then do not cover that with a plaster, but make a wrapping of hard cloths in that place instead of the plaster and tighten it with those.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when after a day or two the plague begins to start, that in it there is generated a swelling, then you remove from above the cloth which you had placed on it with care, and then administer poultices, with those which of our custom is that we medicate the plagues, such as tetrafarmacon and similar ones to that.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is convenient for you that you untie the bandage and consider the plague every day morning and evening before it is consolidated and hardened, and that the limb be prepared in such a manner that the pus runs from it to the parts below with facilitated.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If to the plague pass many days, and it is not consolidated nor is the swelling separated from it, then you know that here are satagias of the small ones for which you must inquire the plague with a probe.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those satagias those that are separated remove and extract, those that of them are not separated and put the limb and cause to happen pain, pierce you to incise those as to you it is possible.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if it happens to the plague a suppuration or elution, it is stiomenios, or another kind of corruption and putrefaction, then you must put on each of those with that which is convenient to it of the cure of which is preceded narration in its chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o .xxx.; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And of this in which you must know the best sermon and you make present your patient: when the bone is broken, support the limb as the bone of the hip and the auxiliary and similar ones to those of the large members, and that you do not presume traction of it, nor the extraction of it for many times happens by this the death; have left it until it can be healed, for very soon it will fall by itself after 20 days or 30. And then cure the plague if to you is seen, and if not leave that.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Of the cure of nodes that happen in the trace of any fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Many times happens this node in the trace of healing of fracture, and mostly that it is near the joints, and is deformed by it the figure of the limb; and very soon prohibits the limb of its natural operation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Therefore consider if the node is recent and administers in that medicines that have stipulated as such as aloen, and ensis, and mira, and sercacollo, and acrassia, and similar ones; in this way that you take from that some or all, and composes those with wine, or with album of hen, or with wine of vinegar, and put that on the node in linen, and constrict those on it by good constriction.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And leave the constriction that you do not untie that for many days; and then untie that and iterate another, until that the node is removed; or strengthen on that lamina of lead descentment, because lead has property of removing all that is inflated in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if the node is already in a worse converted and tight is and necessity provokes to remove that coydament, and then you cut that by the part pus sovereign of it, and incise the superfluity and eminent, or rat that with some rezzors until it is removed; and cure that until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Of the restoration of fracture when it is restored and then that the limb remains subtle and frail not according to its nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When fracture of bone is restored, and then that the limb remains subtle and frail, then that is not done but for many causes: of which the one is multitude of solution of the ligament and of the ligament of it made not according to that which should be; or for superfluity of constriction of the ligaments until that the nourishment be prohibited to run to the limb; or for multitude of superfluous embrocation; or for superfluous movement not in its hour; or for scarcity of blood in the body of the patient and for weakness of it.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And cure of that is to give to the patient to eat and to make the heart of him tender until that the blood be multiplied in him; and administer baths; and introduce gaug and letitia over him.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And then put a poultice on the limb, so that the poultice attracts to it much nourishment, or continue embrocation of it with aygua tebeza, until that the nourishment runs and returns to its natural figure.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Of the cure of the broken bones when they are restored crookedly and prohibits the operation of them of that which should be.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When it happens to the limb already restored during the healing of it of crookedness and eminence of the broken bone and node, and it is for that feeded of form of the limb, but however the limb is not prohibited of its natural operation, then you must not receive the word of that one who exists that member be of new broken.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But already there have been many foolish physicians and restorers the ones who have done that in our land; and this operation is very vituperable, producing great fear, the sign of which is mortal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	But if the lameness and node are recent, then you must be embrocated with aygua tebeza in which are put mollifying herbs, such as the leaves of altea and roots of it, and melilot, and similar ones; and be made a plaster with a mollifying plaster such as dyallaquilon well made; or that is taken mucillage of root of altea and is contused with gray of gualina or with oil of cera, and be plastered with that; or that are taken figs fat and are trissadas with feathers of dove, and similar ones of the medicines that are called amermans consolidation.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And sometimes it is dissolved with continuous light friction with the hands, and movement of the limb is administered throughout the day.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	But if the curvature has already been added and is made strong and converted into a worse condition, and the need for its cure with iron arises, then it is necessary that it is the most exposed part and the continuation of the bone is dissolved, and that which is superfluous of the knot of that part is cut with the bone with subtle scissors, and it is administered facility in that with diligence and study.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of the speech in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the displacement of any of the joints of its place, so that movement is prohibited, and the figure of the limb is distorted, and it brings upon the patient pains and great injuries.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when an accident occurs to any dislocation, it is necessary to immediately try to reduce it, and not delay that reduction, because if it is delayed, the place is inflamed and very difficult to reduce the dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for this reason, one should not be harmed or stretched during the time of inflammation, because many times it brings on spasms and sharp pains.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when this happens, it is necessary that you get to the flaying of the patient, and then let it rest until the inflammation subsides; and then the limb is wrapped with warm water and oil, and it is reduced with facility.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And every member should be cured with that by which the memory will come back to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And you have already ordered the chapters of dislocation according to what has preceded in fracture; from the part of the body most sovereign to the part most inferior.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of the cure of dislocation of the lower jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So the two jaws are dislocated if it is not tardy; and the dislocation of both is made in one of two ways: that they are pulled from their places by little movement, and are softened a little; or they are dislocated by entire dislocation and complicated, so that they are softened at the junction until the saliva of the patient flows and that it cannot hold it or close its mouth, and the tongue of it is enveloped in its word.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation of it is little, then in the major dispositions it returns by itself with little cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is entire and complicated, then it is necessary that the reduction of it be administered lightly, and not be delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And it is that the minister has the head of the patient, and the doctor inserts his thumb of one of his hands into the root of the dislocation of the lower jaw from the inside of his mouth, if the dislocation is of one part; or that he inserts his two thumbs together, if the dislocation is of two parts, and the other said of his hands are outside with which he equalizes; and he commands the patient to cease his jaws and let those go from each part; and the doctor equalizes the jaw and pushes the jaw until it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction of it is difficult, and especially if both jaws are dislocated at the same time, then administer vaporization with warm water and oil, until the reduction of both is made lightly and do not delay the reduction of both at all, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And therefore, when they return and are equalized, and the mouth of the patient is closed and is not softened, then put on those powders of cloth with cerot, and it is made of wax and oil rubbed; and then it is applied with facility with soft bandages.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on his back, and his head be standing between two pillows, so that it does not harm him to the right or left part; and do not let him chew for any cause; having his food be forbidden lion, until when the pains are reduced and the jaws are healed, then let him chew as he wants.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this be administered with facility, and do not work on the opening of the mouth of the patient, the eating and drinking and spitting, until the jaw is healed and cured.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of two jaws when they are dislocated at any time and are not converted to their places, then many times this happens fever and continuous soda, and very much is alerted the belly of the patient, and very much and vomits pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then you know that it is pernicious; and many times that one dies who this happens to in ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the clavicle and of the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The clavicle is not dislocated from the place from its continuation with the feet; and sometimes it is dislocated at the outside part, and this is declared to the feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of it is that the patient lies on his back and extends his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And then grasp the place with your palm with firm grasp, so that it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And then put on that plaster and powders and strengthen that.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the extremity of that which is joined and continued with it, is not dislocated in any day; then it is necessary that it be reduced and equalized according to what we have said and according to what is your equipment.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then place a plaster, and powder, and bandage on it, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until it is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And with this same cure, the extremity of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter .xxvi.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, one of which is that it is dislocated from the part of the thigh to the part below.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated in the part below the muscle, and that is done quickly; and it is not dislocated in the parts behind by the shoulder; and it is not dislocated in the parts in front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And most commonly it is dislocated and thrown out to the parts below the thigh, and most in those whose flesh is little, it is easily dislocated; but in those in which there is much flesh, it is thrown out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And often accidents happen to some men by a blow or fall, and the muscle of them is separated from its place by a cauterized abscess, and it is cured by that which is already dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore, know that you should reduce it while you are above it, and then proceed in the cure of it.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is known that the dislocation of it is when it is in the parts below the thigh; so that you may distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the healthy one, for you find between those a manifest diversity; and you find in the head of the muscle concavity and below the thigh the touch of the head of the muscle as if a gourd, and the patient cannot reduce his hand to his ear, nor move it by all movements.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated below the foot or above, and then you find a manifest touch, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation is made a light reduction when it is fresh and the patient is a child.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister elevates his hand to the parts below; and then places his thumbs below the thigh of him, and elevates the joint with strength upwards to its place, and the minister elevates his hand, and extends that upwards; and then places that below where it returns slightly.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if by what we have said it does not return, and it is from the beginning that the dislocation occurred, many days, then know that the patient should be bathed in lukewarm water and administered a poultice that softens and lubricates as if it were made of boiled roots of aloe, fennel, and melilot in water, and it should be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient should be laid on his back and placed below the thigh of him, waiting for a bandage between elevation and constriction, and the physician places his hand on the sphere, and elevates the head of the muscle upwards, and pulls the hand of the patient so that it is not moved to the parts below, and another minister holds the head of the patient, so that it is not moved to the parts below, for that instantly returns to its place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce it in this manner: and that is that you make a man present who is longer than the patient, and he is on the part of that side, and interlaces his muscle below the thigh of the patient and elevates his thigh to the parts above while the patient is suspended in the air, and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the parts below his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is light, then know that with him that other cause should be suspended, so that the heavy one is supported, for the dislocation returns instantly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced easily in another manner: and it is that a long staff be placed on the ground, the head of which is rounded in shape, as if a mortar, that it be neither thick nor thin, and then placed below the patient; because on the head of the staff, linen cloths are placed, and the patient stands according to the length of the staff, and then the hand of him is extended to the parts below the other side; and the body of him is extended from the other side with strength, for the joint returns to its place with speed.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if the reduction of it is difficult for all the causes that we have said, then use this cure: and it is that you take a staff the length of which is in the length of two arms, and the width of it is of four fingers, and the thickness of it is lessened in the middle of the thigh according to this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And on the rounded head, there are placed linen cloths so that the staff does not hurt the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then it is placed below the thigh of the patient, and the hand or arm is extended over the staff into the parts below, and the staff is tied over the assistant and the arm and the extremity of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then the arm is placed on a step of a ladder according to the width, and the hand is extended to the parts below, and the other body is suspended from the other side, for the joint enters instantly.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And as the entry of it is completed in whichever manner that is possible to you, then know that you should place below the thigh a bandage of linen of equal quantity; and then place a plaster prepared of powder of meal mixed with eggs and albumen of egg over the whole muscle, so that it is rolled upwards, and then a strength below the thigh with decent constriction; and the ligament is rolled over the plaster, and the hand of him is attached to the neck of him, and it is left, and the hand of him is not moved for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And that the patient's food be kept small, until the limb is comforted, for it is lighter for its healing.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then when the food is given greater near the fifth or sixth, and movement is exercised; and therefore if it is stopped and not softened, then it is already healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated many times by humidity that happens to it or for another cause, then it is necessary that in that one cautery is administered with three points, according to what is said before in the chapter of cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and after seven days the ligament is loosened and the joint is not fixed, and the plaster and the constriction are reduced over it several times, and it is not fixed and it catz and cannot elevate that arm to the upper parts, then know that the nerves of it, which are at the head of the muscle, are already cut or extended or softened, and know that the joint will never be fixed in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	Of the dislocation of that one which is made of the foot and the heel or the parts behind, the reduction is made with impulse and extension with the hands, until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And let the other constriction be administered in that one, and care for that one until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if it happens that during healing gravity falls on the limb and slowness in its movement, then the patient uses baths many times until that gravity is relieved and returns to its nature first.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter .xxvii.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of the cure of dislocation of the hip.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.
