Know that the hip joint is dislocated with difficulty and seemingly returns with difficulty; and that is dislocated to all parts, and more to the front part than to the back part, and the dislocation of it is not easy to be known because it is hidden from the sight or from the touch according to what figure it is dislocated, and when you adjust the dislocated hip with the hand, this is declared to you manifestly, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch with that one its muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And that you set the hips, and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible before an abscess comes to it, for if it comes to it an abscess, the reduction is difficult, and it is not healed of all; and more so when it is in the back parts, because it is worse of all the other kinds of dislocations, and of greater pain, and many times they leave to it death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when that one is possible to reduce, is that the hand of it be extended with two hands, and the arm of it be expanded, and the hands of the doctor be over the hip and under it, and he pushes the joint with the knuckles of his hands together, or with the root of his palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is in the front parts, then it returns as if bending the hand with its hand, until it strikes the hip with the root of its palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer vehement extension and strong force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two ministers extend the arm, and hold that raising of the ministers so that it is not remounted from the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then be revolved the arm completely, because it is enveloped cloth folded long over the hand of it, or ligament.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, anoint that one with some oil so that this is those causes which help in the lubrication of the joint with facility; and then pushes the joint with impulse vehement until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And after the reduction of it, it is necessary that it be laid upon that plaster in which there is sticking and application with album of egg, and be extended with a descending constriction, and the arm be suspended from the neck, and be left for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And after it is loosened; and therefore if the joint is formed in its place, then you loosen the ligament of it and leave it.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if sometimes the joint does not become stronger, then you reiterate the plaster and the ligament, and leave it for some days until it is extended; and after loosen it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if it happens to it gravity after the reduction of the joint, and the disposition of it is in movement, then administer moisture in baths and subtle friction, and compression, until it is relieved; or place over the joint a poultice of greasy matter; and then be bound, and leave it over the bones both day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And after you remove that, and put that one in a bath; and when it is dry, then you rub the joint with temperate friction, and then reiterate over that poultice, so is a poultice of greasy matter, once, and the second, and the third.
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already arrived upon the tooth inside the mouth, while it is still soft.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want, place over that a piece of cowhide wet and scalded with butter and strengthened over that; and do this some times, because that one is wet and reduces to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .xxviii.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of the cure of dislocation of the malassen, so is of the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	Malassen of the hand some times is dislocated, and the reduction of the dislocation of it is lighter, and the contrary is of the other joints, but however, it is necessary that it be velocity in the reduction of it in the hour in which it is dislocated, before the place is apostematized or that something happens to it abscess.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of the dislocation of him is that you place the joint of the patient's hand on a table and the assistant extends the hand of that one, and the doctor places his hand or his palm on the prominence of the joint, and pushes it in while it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	But however, it should be considered if the palm is already placed on the belly of the hand, then the patient places the back of his hand on a table,  and the extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is precedent, then the back of the hand, then the position of the hand of that one intrinsically on the table, so that the hand of the doctor lies on that prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And therefore if it returns at once, it is good; and if not, then strengthen that with a poultice,  yielding the abscess and leaving it; and do not repeat this, because if not, do not suffer nor can you over the reduction of it more than days pass.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But however, the joint remains according to its tortuosity; and do not notice to the patient any cause, except that the hand is softened and cannot strengthen any cause; then you know that the nerves are broken or twisted, and then there is no remedy in it except that it be strengthened with a cautery near the place of it and very strongly confer any cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore, as the malasse is returned, then place on it the poultice which have recomposed, and let it be left and strengthened for 5 days; and then it should be removed and let it be left and the hand of it be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if the movement of it is stayed and there is any weight on it, then gently that with water cauda and with friction several times, until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter .xxix.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the cure of dislocations of the said.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes the fingers are dislocated in every part.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a finger is dislocated of those at the back of the palm or on the belly of it, then stretch the finger and push the dislocation of it with your fingers, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the finger, and suspend that part to which it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend that and extend that until straight it is healed in that its day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it will be night, tie that according to that narration, and do not cease to untie that in the day and exercise with movement, and tie that in the night; and do this for some days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do seeming with this, if it is dislocated on the belly of the hand, and tie that to that part and do with this your first operation, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do with this when it is dislocated to the other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter .xxx.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the cure of dislocations of the vertebrae of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When an accident happens to any of the vertebrae of the back or of the neck, a complicated dislocation, and the movable vertebrae are removed from their places, then in that there is no cure, because death takes hold of the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And a sign of this is that the digestion of the patient is outside his will, and he cannot retain that; and many times are softened some limbs of him or two legs of him or two arms of him, or one of those; or a vertebra is removed from its place, because many times it is removed and many times is made the removal of those to four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore that is already removed to the parts behind and is called gelbozit.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But the cure of it is that then you consider if the gelbozit accident of puerility, because then in that there is no cure nor of that there is no healing of all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in that which comes by accident or by percussion or seeming to those, already said the Ancients the ways of cure with sermon prolixs, of which the most returns with prophecy; but I have already and abbreviated of that of which the few excuses of the trop of it, for the my better proximity to the better understanding exposition, with which I have this exposed and formed ex instrument divers of that with which I show this and expose that.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in gelbositis that accidents from the part forward in the feet, there is no remedy nor healing of that; and similarly in that which is made to two sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those there is no cure except that which accidents in the back properly with this that I have recomposed.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient be extended on his face over a pug even proper of wall, and be extended below him instrument molh so that not be lifted the feet of him.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight stick be placed, fixed in the earth at the extremity of the pug around the head of it, and another stick in the aviro the feet of it at the other extremity of the pug.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the assistant holds the stick, and it not be fixed in fossa; and another assistant holds the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then envelop over the head of the patient and below the titilllic liamen leon firm; and extend the extremity of the liamen to the stick which is of the head of it, and tie that in it; and then strengthen the other liament over the hips of it the denols of it, and of the legs of it; and then adjust all the liamentz and tie those in the other stick which is of the feet of it.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then the minister, having casqued, extends the ligament to the part of the shaft, and do not be removed the two shafts and ligaments of their places in which they are placed, but however do not be stopped as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the physician places his palms on the spine with strength while it returns, or that which places upon that a table, and then that adjusts upon the table his feet while it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return in this way, then take a table of which the width or length be in a ratio of three braccia, and carve in the wall of which we have said that it is near the patient a place in which enters the extremity of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the majority of the table upon the spine, and the physician places his feet upon the other extremity, and strengthens well until the spine be contracted and that it returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open with a turn the one that is revolved with the hand; and it is that you fix on the ground the head of the patient in the rear of the pug two shafts, the length of which be of one braccio, and in the rear of the pug also two shafts; and be the length that is between each shaft a palm, and already is made in each shaft a trough in which runs the turn, and each one be firmly fixed on the ground so that it not be moved.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And be also a shaft rounded in which is the turn, and be revolved in the two troughs of the two shafts.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And in the extremity of it is a trough in which is formed the shaft, the length of which is a palm with that which is revolved; and in the two other shafts is similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then strengthen the ligaments that you have straightened in the feet of the patient in the trough which is in the rear of the head of it, and the ligaments that you have straightened in the thighs of it in the turn which is in the rear of the feet of it.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then place each turn and stay a minister that twists the turn with his hand, and the physician engualhe the spine according to what we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And as soon as the spine is returned, and the place is aligned, then cover that you place a plaster exsiccative with album of how, and then cotton; and then place upon the plaster a table of which the width be of three digits or around those, and the length of it be the quantity that prengues the place of the yellowness, and upon the part of the spine it be.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then tie it with the ligament which we have said, and use the patient of subtle nourishment until it be healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there remain any imminence in the place at the end of the healing, then cover that medicines be administered that soften and cleanse with administration of the table for long time, which we have recommended; and already is administered in that place a lamina of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And some times accidents imminence in the rear of the spines of the two, and it is cured by that dislocation; and it is that bone which already imineys for that you cover that it be made prosompcio to it with this medicine, because very strong it will make you to happen death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter .xxxI.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the cure of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle should not be dislocated only, and accidents do not happen to those that happen to the other joints of small movement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated according to four manners, because it is dislocated to the parts in front, or to the parts outside, or to the parts behind, or to the parts in front.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And mostly it is dislocated to the parts in front, and few to the parts behind or to the parts in front.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of the dislocation of it to the parts in front is that, when you adjust the leg of the healthy patient with the patient, it is longer and the tendon is more prominent than of the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend their leg in front of the knee, and it is the place that if the knee is inflamed with cautery, so that the head of the thigh has already arrived here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that one which happens dislocation is to the parts outside, is that the accidents of it are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that one which happens dislocation to the parts in front is that it expands its leg according to its complement, but however it does not bend that which is pain in the tendon, and if it persists to go and cannot over that to the parts in front; and the urine of it is retained and the groin of it is inflamed, and of the ambulation of it over the heel.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that one which happens dislocation to the parts behind is that it does not expand the tendon, nor can it bend that which bends the groin, and the leg of it is shorter than the other, and the groin is softened, and the head of the thigh is in that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of the species of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it is already fixed with that one, then you administer reduction of it and it remains according to its disposition, then it is not in that cure of all; and therefore you cover that in that one be made prosompcio.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in the case of which the dislocation is recent, and is one of the four species of dislocation, then take hold of that which you want to return the joint and extend it to the inside and outside parts, and move it to the right and left, for it will return very quickly and does not need other care.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this manner, then take hold of that which you prepare, and extend the leg of the patient from the back part, or by his hands, or by a bandage which is tied above the knee; and another minister extend the hand of that one from below so that he puts his hands behind the knees of him; and then tighten with a bandage on the root of the groin, and hold another minister the extremity of the bandage.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And the extension of him or from the inside part to the angle of the collarbone, or from the back part to the part of the spine.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And the extension of all those at once while the patient is elevated with his body from the ground and remains hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is special common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And therefore if the dislocation returns with what we have said, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to all species that we will say of the proper cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of him proper, when he is dislocated, and the dislocation is to the inside parts, then the patient must be laid on his side; and then place the bandages on the root of the groin in that place which is between the head of the groin and the place that is below the collarbone; and then extend the bandage from the top of the collarbone to the highest part of the furcula.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another minister strongly presses the arms of him, and warm the thick place of the groin of the patient and extend to the outside parts by vehement extension, for that returns to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is of lighter cure with which this member is reduced than the others.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is excused over you and does not obey the entrance with this species of cure of all, then it is necessary that the two legs of the patient are tied together with a strong, light bandage, on both the ankles and both the knees.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each of its parts is the quantity of four fingers, and the leg of the patient extended more than the other by the quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then the patient is suspended over the top of the pole, and that he is in the middle; and the length of him from the ground is the quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then command a strong young man to pull the head of the groin, and that he is suspended with the patient another young man, and the other young man pulls the groin with strength and pushes, for the joint returns to its place with speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the proper reduction, when the dislocation is to the outside part, then the patient must lie on his stomach according to what we have recommended in the having of the groin; and be tightened the bandage on the leg of the patient properly and on his feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then two poles are placed, one at his feet, and the other at the head; and then poles are placed adjusted in the middle of the groin, on which damp cloths are enveloped, so that the patient is not damaged because the pole is between his thighs, for that the extension to the inside parts is not pulled.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then each minister extends his part, and the doctor with his hand engulfs the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey to the reverse, it will be very good; and if not, pause on that diligently and as we have said in the groin for that engulment.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But the patient must lie on his side.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is to the front parts, then the leg must be extended slightly, and it is according to this same narration about groin; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand on the groin of the patient, and then pulls that with the other hand, and with that pull he pauses that extended to the inside parts to the part of the knee.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is to the back parts, then the patient must not be extended to the inside parts, and it is elevated above the ground; he must be placed on a hard cause, as if the dislocation is to the outside parts, according to what we have said of the placing of him on two planks; and it is on his back and the bandages are extended, as we have said, there is no harm.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it must be administered compression with a board over the place where the joint is.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore, as the reduction is complicated according to what you must — the sign of the reduction of him is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend from the patient two legs, and when you see those engulfs and the patient extends his leg and expands that his excuse, then you know that the member according to what you must is returned — and then you adjust two bandages and pause ointment and extend with bandage so that the width is not harmed in any of the parts; and adhere the patient to rest for three days or for four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then untie the bandage and the ointment, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Now, if you see those joints in alignment, then you know that the dislocation is already fixed, and therefore let the patient go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause for softening, then you return and plaster that, and stretch that according to your first structure, and leave it for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then unwrap that, and make that one delay in walking for a few days, until it is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the cure of dislocation of the knee.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The knee is dislocated in three ways, which is dislocated to the outside parts, and to the inside parts, and to the parts in front to the parts behind; and to the front parts it is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation of it is that you command the patient to apply his leg to the thigh; then you know that the knee is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all the ways of it is that you make the patient straight, so that he already extends his leg, if he can above that; adhere your two hands to the face of it, and place his foot between your feet; and then make adhere the knee of it to your palms, and keep those between your fingers on the knee of it with strength, and another minister extends his leg while the knee returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of the return of it is that his leg adheres to the thigh with lightness without labor.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then plaster that and make the leg adhere to the thigh, and then tie those immediately with a bandage for three days or for four, and then unwrap those.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the patient for walking for a few days, until it is healed and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if the reduction of it to you is excused, then administer strong extension with ligaments of which in the cure of the hamstring preceding narrative.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the cure of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle some times is dislocated by small movement, and some times is dislocated according to compliment, and the dislocation of it is made either to the inside parts or to the outside parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of the dislocation of it is that you see the ankle inflated proceeding to the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the cure of the dislocation of it is of lightness reduction, and is that it be extended with facility with the hands and be aligned while it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the cure of it when it is dislocated according to compliment, it is necessary that you make the patient straight, and have one strong and valiant minister of the part behind the two of it in the middle location of it.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you with your right hand the foot of the most sovereign part, and with your left hand of the part more below the foot in the location of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then you pull the foot to you with your right hand, and with the left for two times, and then extend with the left; and push the foot of the foot with the right, so that the leg works.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this two times according to that we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then push the foot of the foot to the leg the third time, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore if it returns in one time or in two according to this manner, and if you see the foot aligned, it is good; and if not, then over it iterate the operation, because that returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if to you is forbidden the reduction of it with that we have recounted, then make the patient lie on his two on the ground, and stretch a padded mat on the ground firm, and that it sits between the thighs of it, and you already have enveloped over it cloth so that it does not scratch the patient.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And then the minister of it holds its thighs, and another minister extends the leg with its hands or with a ligament that lies on the collar of the foot; and then extend that each minister against extension of its part, and the mat be extant between the thighs of the patient retaining that, so that the body of it not be pulled to the parts below because of its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And then the physician aligns the dislocation with its hands, and another minister holds the healthy thigh to the parts below, because the dislocation returns with facility.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And therefore when it returns the dislocation and is declared to you the health of the reduction of it, then pause plaster and extend that with ligaments strongly, and tie the foot with ligaments to the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And be careful and guard yourself of the nerves which are behind over the ankle, so that the ligament over it not be vehement and injure it strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave it for two days or three; and if the ligament is softened, extend it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then unwrap it on the third day or on the fourth, and prohibit the patient from movement for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is forced to go before that space, it is not done safely that the dislocation not be over it dissolved and corrupted, and then that it does not receive cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if it happens to it an abscess, then you must administer in the reduction of it that in the location of our narration, in another place of cure and of embrocation, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter .xxxiiii.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the cure of dislocation of the toes.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	So that the one that is dislocated be straightened with little extension of his work; and that which is not difficult, lift it lightly.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in some joints of the foot, then you must make the patient put his foot on a level place of the earth or on a table, and standing thus as if he were going.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand beside his feet, and place your foot upon that which encroaches from the joints, and then press it with your foot with virtue until it returns, and that you see it already straightened and does not appear in the place eminence.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place under the foot of him a table that supports the whole foot, which has two heads, and then strengthen it with a decent and firm structure for three days; and then untie it and make him rest from walking for many days, until it is strengthened and its return is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxxv.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the kinds of dislocation that are made with plague or with fracture or with any of them together.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those causes occur, and you are engaged in the cure of it and in the restoration of it, many times it happens that death occurs.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for this reason you must not presume over the cure of it, but rather the one who is wise in the art, of long usage, merciful and compassionate, tardy, not bold nor presumptuous; and that uses in the beginning of medicines that cause abscesses as little as possible, and leaves the patient to the divine judgment, except to the one whom you hope for salvation from perdition, with the alleviation of the illness, and in which appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore strive as soon as possible to make the reduction of it at the beginning of the cause, before it becomes an abscess.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And therefore if the limb returns as we want, then administer the regimen which causes abscesses and cures the plague with what is convenient for it of the dried herbs.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is with a fracture and it happens in the bones separated, then you pierce the stem of them, and do in that what we have said in the simple illnesses of that which is preceded in the places of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid according to your virtue that of the instrument in the ways of fear according to what has preceded you my preaching; for this is better to you, you owe your Creator, and more permanent to your glory, and more greetings to your true body in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Albucasim perfectly of which may God be the benefit.
Amen.	Amen.
